ANIM.name: Animation
ANIM.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Foundational Tools for Animation & VFX
courses.description: Students will learn fundamentals of core tools in Digital Animation & Visual Effects related disciplines. Tools introduced include pixel based image manipulation tools (such as Photoshop), vector based graphics tools (such as Illustrator), video and animation compositing tools (such as After Effects and Nuke) and 3D CGI tools (such as Maya). Animation and visual effects related applications introduced include digital image alteration, digital matte painting, three dimensional type creation, and other foundational animation and visual effects tasks.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Digital Imaging for Animation & VFX
courses.description: Students learn foundational image acquisition, lighting and processing techniques and principles utilized in Animation & VFX disciplines. Topics covered include digital still and video imaging and lighting fundamentals for reference and background gathering, texture creation, normal map sampling, spherical and high dynamic range acquisition, location survey and more.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Introduction to Production with Animation & VFX
courses.description: This course introduces students to many of the core principles, techniques and technologies employed in the creation of media incorporating animation and visual effects. The basics of planning and shooting live action, greenscreen and still image media are introduced in conjunction with design, creation, animation and compositing of both 2D and 3D assets.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 211 [Min Grade: D] or ANIM 100 [Min Grade: D] or PHTO 141 [Min Grade: D] or VSCM 200 [Min Grade: D] or DIGM 100 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Computer Graphics Imagery I
courses.description: Students learn to represent 3D objects and spaces in 2D media using a variety of drawing and computer graphic techniques. This course lays important foundations for subsequent courses in 3D computer modeling and animation.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Computer Graphics Imagery II
courses.description: This course will introduce students to the principles and techniques of 3D virtual scene building for animation, visualization and game development.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 140 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Realtime Visualization
courses.description: In this course, students learn principles and techniques of scene building in realtime, 3D interactive graphics engines for use in animation, visualization, game design, VR, AR and other forms of digital media.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 140 [Min Grade: D] or ARCH 134 [Min Grade: D] or INTR 245 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Basic Portfolio
courses.description: This course focuses on the basics of portfolio creation, editing, and presentation while examining portfolio examples of current professionals in various industry roles that can serve as models for student portfolio development.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ANFX.

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Multimedia Timeline Design
courses.description: Introduces basic design concepts and tools to create time based 2D and 3D multimedia. Addresses issues from pre-production planning, through post-production and delivery; emphasis on time-based multimedia.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 100 [Min Grade: D] or DIGM 100 [Min Grade: D] or PHTO 141 [Min Grade: D] or VSCM 200 [Min Grade: D] or GMAP 101 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Previsualization for Animated Production
courses.description: Previsualization is the all-important design and planning process that takes place before embarking on the production of an animation or visual effects piece. In this course, student will learn and practice the creation, motivation and use of pre-production plans, concept art, mood boards, shot storyboarding, animatics, performance reference and other topics integral to the previsualization process.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 140 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Animation I
courses.description: Explores computer animation with an introduction to concepts of 3D animation. Includes narrative structure, storyboarding, and development. Emphasizes aesthetic, technical and conceptual issues. Requires students to create short, 3D animations.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 140 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Animation II
courses.description: Builds on topics introduced in ANIM 211 Animation I, incorporating advanced animation techniques such as inverse kinematics and dynamics. Requires students to propose, design, and produce a short animation.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 211 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Rigging I
courses.description: This class will introduce students to the fundamental concepts of IK and FK rigging, weight painting, and deformation solutions for humanoid characters. Lectures may also include common rigging solutions for other miscellaneous tasks and advanced-level topics.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 211 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Digital Character Creation
courses.description: This course introduces all aspects of digital character creation within a 3D environment. Students will learn how to model and rig humanoid characters optimal for both real time and raytraced render environments. Topics covered will include modeling and topology for characters, FK/IK rigs, and production workflows for character integration.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 212 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: History of Animation
courses.description: Students learn the pre-cursors to modern animation and the evolution of the art since the beginning of the 20th century. Concepts in both 2D and 3D animation will be covered.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Digital Compositing I
courses.description: Examines digital compositing possibilities through the manipulation and recombination of acquired and produced digital imagery, including study of digital image and video formats, color space, live action digital matte painting, Greenscreen/Bluescreen compositing, rotoscope masking and 2D tracking.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 140 [Min Grade: D] or ANIM 110 [Min Grade: D] or FMTV 110 [Min Grade: D] or VRIM 110 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Digital Compositing II
courses.description: Examines 2D and 3D digital compositing possibilities through the manipulation and recombination of acquired and produced digital imagery, including 2D/3D Integration, 3D Matchmoving, and High Dynamic Range Imagery.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 140 [Min Grade: D] and ANIM 220 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Digital Matte Painting
courses.description: Students will build upon existing compositing and animation knowledge to create digital matte painting visual effects shots using 2D and 3D approaches. This course will teach students the process of creating dramatic scenes that leverage movement, depth, and scale.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 220 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Scripting for Animation and Visual Effects
courses.description: This course explores modern scripting languages utilized in Animation and Visual Effects operating systems and software tools that are integral to artist productivity and production pipeline scalability.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: CS 140 [Min Grade: D] or CS 150 [Min Grade: D] or CS 171 [Min Grade: D] or DIGM 131 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Lighting & Surfacing
courses.description: Students will continue to build on core skills by diving deeper into texture and shader development as well as lighting techniques for the purposes of creating photorealistic digital imagery. Several render engines will be introduced allowing students to recognize core concepts universal to lighting and surfacing and improving production versatility.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 140 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Advanced Portfolio
courses.description: This course focuses on building skills for the career-long practice of producing and maintaining a professional creative portfolio while allowing the students the opportunity to create or refine additional student-driven portfolio work that synthesizes their skills and experience from direct class assignments in their other coursework.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 3 credits
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 146 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Organic Modeling I
courses.description: This course presents an intensive exploration of human character modeling and rigging for animation, with emphasis on human anatomy and articulation. Through lectures, demonstrations, class critiques and individual feedback from peers and the instructor, students will learn best practices for modeling human forms for animation and why these approaches are valid. Although the focus is on humans, the concepts and techniques presented for organic modeling, sculpting and rigging apply to all organic characters.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 141 [Min Grade: C] or ANIM 145 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Advanced Lighting
courses.description: Students will learn to integrate production-oriented lighting techniques into animation. Techniques utilizing both point-based and raytraced global illumination will be covered, and how to optimize pipelines for animation. Basic shader development will also be covered.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 141 [Min Grade: D] or ANIM 145 [Min Grade: D] or ANIM 240 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Professional Practices for Animation & VFX
courses.description: Provides a professional orientation to the animation and visual effects industry through an exploration of a variety of projects and studies. In addition to lecture and discussions, students learn to take active part in role plays and presentations to achieve an understanding of the importance of team building, team work, and team management in all phases of animation and visual effects productions from proposals to final delivery, as well as personal development and promotion through personal learning, development of work demonstration materials.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 211 [Min Grade: D] or ANIM 221 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Procedural Animation
courses.description: This class introduces students to the fundamentals of procedurally generated 3D content. Students will learn procedural tools for the generation of different effects systems in topics such as modeling, rigging, animation, visual effects, and look development.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 140 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Character Animation I
courses.description: In this course, students learn humanoid rigging, body mechanics, body language and theories of acting with emphasis on having characters emote and perform with deliberateness of action. The course will culminate with a two character pantomime animation that students will create with a partner.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 212 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Character Animation II
courses.description: Students learn human facial deformation and movement as it’s applied to thought driven character performance.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 314 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Organic Modeling II
courses.description: In this course, students will learn organic modeling of creatures, both real and imagined, for animation, taking into consideration anatomy, articulation and the fundamentals of creature design. In addition, we’ll look at various concepts and techniques for rigging animals and creatures as you’ll develop and present your own creature, modeled, sculpted, rigged, and posed in a final animation.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 247 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Animation Workshop I
courses.description: This course examines leadership and developmental roles involved in each stage of a collaborative production, from concept to finished project. Students will work in groups to research and plan an animation production that results in a pre-production prototype.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 212 [Min Grade: D] and (ANIM 221 [Min Grade: D] or ANIM 247 [Min Grade: D] or ANIM 314 [Min Grade: D])

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Animation Workshop II
courses.description: This course provides an environment in which the pre-production of ANIM 377 Animation Workshop I can be taken through a full production effort. Students will work in groups to bring a selected prototype to completion.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 377 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Advanced Compositing
courses.description: Students learn to create detailed visual effects, and the best methods to integrate them into live-action plates. Drawing on existing compositing and animation knowledge, students will work in groups to produce short visual effects sequences.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 221 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Advanced Animation
courses.description: This course explores a wide range of visual effects assets, both practical and synthetic. Projects focus on the creation of a comprehensive short animation.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 212 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Advanced Visual Effects
courses.description: In this course students will study advanced techniques and software in order to successfully recreate natural phenomenon, simulations, and effects that can be used in the Film, Animation, or Gaming industries.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 301 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Technical Directing for Animation
courses.description: Students learn toolsets for technical direction of animated films and visual effects. The topics covered can include Python scripting, pipeline development and integration, the creation of custom shaders to streamline production processes, and technical direction for lighting, crowds, or other relevant disciplines in the animation and visual effects industry.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 231 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ANIM
courses.title: Independent Study in Animation
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.

ARCH.name: Architecture
ARCH.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Design Foundations I
courses.description: Introduces basic architectural design principles. Elementary concepts of space, surface and form will be explored through investigation of abstract and applied design projects explored in two and three- dimensional abstract exercises. Exercises incorporate heightened observational analysis and graphic skills.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Design Foundations II
courses.description: Investigates basic architectural design principles that emphasize the inter-relationship between the scale of the human body and its movement within three-dimensional space. Design exercises will advance the understanding of the design process, development of a conceptual idea and a higher-level graphic and oral presentation.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 118 [Min Grade: C] or ARCH 191 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Appreciation of Architecture
courses.description: Historical survey of architecture from prehistory through today drawn from around the globe (and from Philadelphia) that considers broadly applicable topics including style, material, construction, and function. Intended for non-majors as an introduction to architecture and urbanism.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture and Society I
courses.description: This survey course examines the evolution of architectural and urban thought, form, space, and structure in light of changing human values and institutions. Particular attention is paid to materials, meaning, and use. It explores global built environments from the prehistoric era through the early Medieval period (9th century CE) in Europe, the Americas, Asia, and Africa.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture and Society II
courses.description: This survey course examines the evolution of architectural and urban thought and form in light of changing human values and institutions, with particular attention paid to materials, technology, meaning, and use. It explores global built environments from the early Medieval period (9th century CE) through the 18th century in Europe, the Americas, Asia, and Africa.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 141 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture and Society III
courses.description: This survey course examines the evolution of architectural and urban thought and form in light of changing human values and institutions, with particular attention paid to materials, technology, meaning, and use. It explores global modern built environments from the 18th century through the 21st century in Europe, the Americas, Asia, Australasia, and Africa.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 142 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Technology I
courses.description: Introduction to the fundamental aspects of building technology with exposure to materials, structure and building systems that are frequently used in building construction. Provides a framework for the exploration of construction in the context of design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHYS 182 [Min Grade: C-] and (MATH 102 [Min Grade: C-] or MATH 183 [Min Grade: C-])
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Technology II
courses.description: Further exploration of materials, structure and building systems and their influence on passive systems and sustainable design principles. Begins the development of systematic thinking regarding architectural technology.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 170 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Technology III
courses.description: Introduction to the technical building analysis including the organizing principles for materials, structure and systems. Includes envelope assembly, thermal comfort, structural and passive building systems.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 172 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture Studio 1A
courses.description: Introduces basic architectural design principles. Elementary concepts of space, surface and form will be explored in two and three dimensional abstract exercises. Exercises incorporate observational analysis and graphic skills.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture Studio 1B
courses.description: Transitions from abstract design principles to simple architectural exercises, considering function, scale, user and ordering strategies in relation to form-making in three-dimensional space. Exercises heighten observation and graphic skills while developing an architectural vocabulary.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 181 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture Studio 1C
courses.description: Focuses on a series of basic architectural problems developed around issues of context and material use in relationship to the organization of space and human activity. Design exercises will cultivate the design process through developing a conceptual idea through graphic and oral communication.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 182 [Min Grade: C] or INTR 233 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Studio 1-AE
courses.description: Architectural engineering majors only. Covers basic design principles using three-dimensional abstract and applied projects. Exercises heighten observation skills.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is AE.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Studio 2-AE
courses.description: Architectural engineering majors only. Continues ARCH 191. Uses design exercises to emphasize the nature of function, structure, and material and their impact on the design process.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 191 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is AE.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Representation I
courses.description: Introductory course that will provide a survey of drawing types with an emphasis on process and visual literacy.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Representation II
courses.description: Emphasis on craft and composition in the architectural representation of the built environment.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 211 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Representation III
courses.description: Exploration of digital representation with an emphasis on making combining process drawing, digital fabrication and analog craft to develop three-dimensional representation skills.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 212 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Materials & Methods I
courses.description: Introduction to the fundamental aspects of building technology with exposure to materials and methods that are frequently used in building construction. Provides a framework for the exploration of construction in the context of design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 183 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Materials & Methods II
courses.description: Further exploration of materials, structure and building systems and their influence on passive systems and sustainable design principles. Begins the development of systematic thinking regarding architectural technology.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 221 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Materials & Methods III
courses.description: Introduction to technical building analysis including the organizing principles for materials, structure and systems. Includes envelope assembly, thermal comfort, structural and passive building systems.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 222 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Representation IV
courses.description: Emphasizes the communication of design through perspective, view-making and rendering. Through the use of digital and analog techniques, the ability to select the proper media to visually convey a design concept will be developed.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 213 [Min Grade: C] and ARCH 183 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Representation V
courses.description: Emphasizes the tools to complete a final quality architectural presentation in a variety of venues including portfolios, digital representations and online media.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 224 [Min Grade: C] and ARCH 281 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Representation VI
courses.description: Explores parametric thinking and the iterative design process while reinforcing critical skills in detailing and design development through various software programs.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 225 [Min Grade: C] and ARCH 282 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Structural Systems I
courses.description: Introduction to the fundamental aspects of structural systems with exposure to materials and methods that are frequently used in building construction. Develops skills needed for structural integration in building design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 183 [Min Grade: C-] and PHYS 182 [Min Grade: C-] and (MATH 102 [Min Grade: C-] or MATH 173 [Min Grade: C-] or MATH 183 [Min Grade: C-])

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Structural Systems II
courses.description: Further introduction to the fundamental aspects of structural systems with exposure to materials and methods that are frequently used in building construction. Develops skills needed for structural integration in building design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 251 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Structural Systems III
courses.description: Introduction and intermediate aspects of structural systems with exposure to materials and methods that are frequently used in building construction. Develops skills needed for structural integration in building design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 252 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Technology IV
courses.description: Intermediate development of architectural technology with a focus on application of analysis of primary materials, structure and systems. Depth and range of analytical tools are addressed.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 173 [Min Grade: C-] and PHYS 183 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Technology V
courses.description: Further development of analytical skills for building technology. Case studies and real world precedents examine materials, structure and systems in the support of larger architectural objectives.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 274 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Technology VI
courses.description: Examination of technical analysis and design in support of iterative architectural concepts. Materials, structure and systems are utilized to develop strong design synergies.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 275 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture Studio 2A
courses.description: Introduces issues of architectural form, site and programmatic concerns. Design exercises will explore simple issues of structure, building and material systems and sustainability.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 183 [Min Grade: C] and (ARCH 213 [Min Grade: C] or INTR 245 [Min Grade: C-])
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture Studio 2B
courses.description: Covers architectural design problems of incremental complexity that emphasizes the nature of function, structure, and material and their impact on the design process.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ((ARCH 221 [Min Grade: C-] and ARCH 251 [Min Grade: C-]) or ARCH 170 [Min Grade: C-] or INTR 351 [Min Grade: C-], ) and ARCH 281 [Min Grade: C] and (ARCH 224 [Min Grade: C] or INTR 341 [Min Grade: C-])
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture Studio 2C
courses.description: Explores architectural design problems that introduce the full range of challenges in the areas of organization, program, context, systems and formal expression.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ((ARCH 222 [Min Grade: C-] and ARCH 252 [Min Grade: C-]) or ARCH 170 [Min Grade: C-]) and ARCH 282 [Min Grade: C] and ARCH 225 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Building Systems I
courses.description: Introduction to architectural technology with a focus on application of analysis pertaining to environmental systems within the context of building design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 283 [Min Grade: C-] and PHYS 182 [Min Grade: C-] and (MATH 102 [Min Grade: C-] or MATH 173 [Min Grade: C-] or MATH 183 [Min Grade: C-])

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Building Systems II
courses.description: Introduction to architectural technology with a focus on design impacts and analysis related to water within the context of building design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 283 [Min Grade: C-] and PHYS 182 [Min Grade: C-] and (MATH 102 [Min Grade: C-] or MATH 173 [Min Grade: C-] or MATH 183 [Min Grade: C-])

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Building Systems III
courses.description: Introduction to architectural technology with a focus on design impacts and analysis related to lighting within the context of building design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 283 [Min Grade: C-] and PHYS 182 [Min Grade: C-] and (MATH 102 [Min Grade: C-] or MATH 173 [Min Grade: C-] or MATH 183 [Min Grade: C-])

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Sustainable Built Environment I
courses.description: Provides an overview of contemporary sustainable design principles and systems involved to posit novel solutions to various design challenges. Combining theoretical knowledge, field trips and case studies enabling students to critically assess sustainability as it relates to the built environment through five key subsystems: materials, air, water, energy and life.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Sustainable Built Environment II
courses.description: Students will examine the work of scientists, designers, authors, artists, architects, engineers, planners, etc to gain a deeper conceptual understanding of current and emerging strategies in sustainability and the complex and integrated systems approach to the built environment in the present and near future.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 315 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Materials & Methods IV
courses.description: Advanced building technology concepts are explored through case studies and focused design examples. Materials, construction, methods, structure, systems and envelope are studied as integrated aspect of larger iterative design processes.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 173 [Min Grade: C-] or ARCH 223 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Materials & Methods V
courses.description: Further exploration of advanced building technology concepts through case studies and focused design examples. Materials, construction, methods, structure, systems and envelope are studied as integrated aspect of larger iterative design processes.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 324 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Materials & Methods VI
courses.description: Advanced integration of building technology concepts through design problems and examples. Materials, construction, methods, structure, systems and envelope are studied as integrated aspect of larger iterative design processes.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 325 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Professional Practice I
courses.description: This seminar is the first of a two-course sequence that introduces students to varying topics related to architectural practice in today's society. It addresses the following issues: Community and Social Responsibility, Leadership, Ethics & Professional Judgment, Client Role in Architecture, Basic Principles of Architectural Practice.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 243 [Min Grade: C-] or ARCH 383 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH or major is INTR.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Professional Practice II
courses.description: This seminar is the second of a two-course sequence that introduces students to varying topics related to architectural practice in today’s society. It addresses the following issues: Practice Management, Project Management, Financial Considerations, Legal Responsibilities, Ethics & Professional Judgment.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 335 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH or major is INTR.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: American Architecture & Urbanism
courses.description: Surveys the development of American architecture and urbanism from its Native American origins through the arrival of early Modernism in the 1930s and 1940s.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 143 [Min Grade: C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Theories of Architecture I
courses.description: Seminar that examines theories and principles of Western architecture before 1700. History/theory elective.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 143 [Min Grade: C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Theories of Architecture II
courses.description: Continues ARCH 341. Seminar that examines theories and principles of Western architecture from the Baroque era of the 17th century to the beginning of Modernism in the 20th century. History/theory elective.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 143 [Min Grade: C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Theories of Architecture III
courses.description: Seminar that examines 20th-century theories of architecture, including analysis and discussion of current theoretical positions. History/theory elective. Spring.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 143 [Min Grade: C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: History of Philadelphia Architecture
courses.description: Covers the architecture of the city of Philadelphia from 1682, examining its architects, styles, and sources through lectures, walking tours, and student reports. History/theory elective. Fall. Alternate years.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 143 [Min Grade: C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Intensive Architectural Studies
courses.description: An intensive study tour of selected domestic and foreign destinations focusing on architecture and related design disciplines. Combines lecture, site visits, sketching and individual research. History/Theory Elective.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 143 [Min Grade: C-] or INTR 200 [Min Grade: C-] or ARTH 103 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Studies in Vernacular Architecture
courses.description: A topical survey of world traditions of vernacular architecture, with emphasis on houses and dwelling environments. The survey topics include basics of shelter, construction methods, response to climate, patterns of settlement, social and economic organization, cultural expression, and methods of research and analysis.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 143 [Min Grade: C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Contemporary Architecture
courses.description: Survey and analysis of significant developments in architecture and urbanism over the past 50+ years.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 143 [Min Grade: C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Structural Systems IV
courses.description: Intermediate aspects of structural systems with exposure to materials and methods that are frequently used in building construction. Develops skills needed for structural integration in building design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 173 [Min Grade: C-] or ARCH 253 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Structural Systems V
courses.description: Intermediate structural analysis for architectural design. Develops skills needed for structural integration in building design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 354 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Structural Systems VI
courses.description: Intermediate structural analysis for architectural design with a focus on composite systems. Develops skills needed for structural integration in building design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 355 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Technology VII
courses.description: Advanced building technology concepts are explored through case studies and focused design examples. Materials, construction, methods, structure, systems and envelope are studied as integrated aspect of larger iterative design processes.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 276 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Technology VIII
courses.description: Building technology and analysis are explored through design precedents and sketch problems to develop integrated design and analytical skills. Focuses on large and small scale elements that can become generative and performative aspects of major design decisions.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 377 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Technology IX
courses.description: Advanced building technology design and analysis is utilized in iterative and integrated design methods to support comprehensive design processes. Materials, structure and systems are developed qualitatively and quantitatively through design and analysis exercises.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 378 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture Studio 3A
courses.description: Investigates the design relationship between man-made and the natural environment. Cultivates advanced analysis methods and the development of informed and resolved design solutions.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 283 [Min Grade: C] and ARCH 226 [Min Grade: C] and ARCH 223 [Min Grade: C] and ARCH 253 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture Studio 3B
courses.description: Studies the relationship between building, site and context. Architectural design problems emphasize concept development that translates careful analysis into the building ideas with a progressing understanding of architectural concerns.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 381 [Min Grade: C] and ARCH 274 [Min Grade: C-] or (ARCH 291 [Min Grade: C-] and ARCH 354 [Min Grade: C-])
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture Studio 3C
courses.description: Focuses on architectural problems with intermediate complexity. Integrates issues of context, site, program, function, and architectural systems into advanced design proposals.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 382 [Min Grade: C] and ARCH 275 [Min Grade: C-] or (ARCH 292 [Min Grade: C-] and ARCH 355 [Min Grade: C-])
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Building Systems IV
courses.description: Intermediate study of architectural technology with a focus on design impacts and analysis related to mechanical systems within the context of building design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 291 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Building Systems V
courses.description: Intermediate study of architectural technology with a focus on design impacts and analysis related to acoustical design and energy consumption within the context of building design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 394 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Building Systems VI
courses.description: Intermediate study of architectural technology with a focus on design impacts and analysis related to lighting and electrical systems within the context of building design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 293 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Environmental Psychology and Design Theory
courses.description: Examines the relationship between human behavior and architecture from the perspective of environmental psychology. Topics include aesthetics, environmental experience, social interaction, social organization, and culture. History/Theory Elective.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 143 [Min Grade: C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architectural Programming
courses.description: Introduces current techniques of building programming and their relationship to building design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 353 [Min Grade: C-] or ARCH 483 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: The Development Process
courses.description: Introduces the process of land development. Explores traditional and emerging development models (the architect as the equity participant and developer) in relation to new construction and rehabilitation. Covers various methods of initiating building projects and financing and tax issues. Professional elective. Spring.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Urban Design Seminar
courses.description: Expands the concept of architecture to urban design scale and presents the principles of city planning through a series of case studies. History/Theory Elective.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 143 [Min Grade: C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Advanced Drawing
courses.description: Covers advanced architectural rendering, concentrating on the effects of light, shade, and color using the techniques of water-color rendering. Professional elective. Spring.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 226 [Min Grade: C-] or INTR 341 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Computer Applications in Architecture
courses.description: Covers two-dimensional and three-dimensional computer representations and applications. Professional elective.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 226 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Case Studies in Architectural Technology
courses.description: A holistic study of design and construction technology of significant buildings by leading architects through case studies. This course offers a unique opportunity to engage the topic of meaning in architecture through the lenses of spatial understanding and methods of technology and construction.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 253 [Min Grade: C-] or INTR 451 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Building Enclosure Design
courses.description: Examines the integrations of aesthetics, building science, and technology in the design of building enclosures. Professional Elective. Summer.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 253 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Energy and Architecture
courses.description: Creates an awareness of the availability of energy resources and their effect on the built environment. Discusses alternative sources of energy. Professional elective.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 253 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: The Architectural Detail
courses.description: This seminar will explore architectural detail as a key to understanding of the craft and intrinsic nature of time, technology and cultural importance of the building.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 326 [Min Grade: C-] or INTR 350 [Min Grade: C-] or INTR 674 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Introduction to Historic Preservation
courses.description: An introduction to historic preservation as it relates to the built environment. The goal of this course is to familiarize the student with the history and the legal, theoretical and policy underpinnings of the historic preservation movement.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: (ARCH 143 [Min Grade: C] or INTR 200 [Min Grade: C]) and (ARCH 283 [Min Grade: C] or INTR 342 [Min Grade: C] or INTR 442 [Min Grade: C])

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture Studio 4A
courses.description: Focuses on more complex architectural challenges through analysis of case studies that address the relationship between the man-made built environment and the natural environment.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 383 [Min Grade: C] and ARCH 276 [Min Grade: C-] or (ARCH 356 [Min Grade: C-] and ARCH 293 [Min Grade: C-])
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture Studio 4B
courses.description: Furthers the understanding of context and design and the application of solutions and strategies surrounding more complex architectural and environmental problems.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 481 [Min Grade: C] and ARCH 377 [Min Grade: C-] or (ARCH 324 [Min Grade: C-] and ARCH 394 [Min Grade: C-])
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture Studio 4C
courses.description: Challenges to develop and refine architectural solutions through an advanced understanding of the relationship between buildings and environment.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 482 [Min Grade: C] and ARCH 378 [Min Grade: C-] or (ARCH 325 [Min Grade: C-] and ARCH 395 [Min Grade: C-])
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Specialized Studio
courses.description: This design studio is taught as a vertical studio combining students from multiple years. Sections of this studio focus on a variety of special issues in the broader realm of architecture, urbanism and design and may be taught as an interdisciplinary studio.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 12 credits
courses.prerequisites: (ARCH 382 [Min Grade: C] or INTR 342 [Min Grade: C-] or INTR 442 [Min Grade: C-]) and ARCH 482 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture Studio 5A
courses.description: Addresses the complex relationship through analysis and synthesis of form, site, program, building technology and theory within specific building context.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 483 [Min Grade: C] and ARCH 379 [Min Grade: C-] or (ARCH 326 [Min Grade: C-] and ARCH 356 [Min Grade: C-] and ARCH 396 [Min Grade: C-])
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture Studio 5B
courses.description: Emphasizes complex architectural problems while demonstrating understanding and appropriate application.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 487 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Architecture Studio 5C
courses.description: Integrates in-depth application and coordination of all architectural building criteria in a large scale and complex architectural problem.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 488 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Capstone Project I
courses.description: This course is the first part of a two-term capstone project consistent with the student’s curricular concentration, and relevant to their professional and academic goals. This course is devoted to an introduction to methods applicable to architectural design and research that will lead to the capstone project in the second term.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 8 credits
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 283 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Capstone Project II
courses.description: This course is the second part of a two-term capstone project consistent with the student’s curricular concentration, and relevant to their professional and academic goals. This course is devoted to the continued research in architectural theory, technology and/or design and the completion and presentation of a capstone project.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 8 credits
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 490 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Senior Project I
courses.description: Students develop a three-term capstone design project to pursue and explore architectural concepts in depth. Students take a project from concept, research, programming to complete design development. Part one of three.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: (ARCH 363 [Min Grade: C-] or ARCH 489 [Min Grade: C]) and ARCH 431 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Senior Project II
courses.description: Students develop a three-term capstone design project to pursue and explore architectural concepts in depth. Students take a project from concept, research, programming to complete design development. Part two of three.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 493 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.subject: ARCH
courses.title: Senior Project III
courses.description: Students develop a three-term capstone design project to pursue and explore architectural concepts in depth. Students take a project from concept, research, programming to complete design development. Part three of three.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 494 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is ARCH.

courses.title: Independent Study in Architecture
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.title: Special Topics in Architecture
courses.description: Covers special topics in architectural history, theory, or technology that satisfy history/theory or professional elective requirements.

courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: History of Art I
courses.description: This course explores the history of visual culture from a global perspective from ancient times to the advent of the early modern period, ca. 1400. Selected cultures from around the world will be examined in terms of their regional traditions as well as their impactful interactions with other cultures. The historical use, value, and meaning of images, buildings, and artifacts will be analyzed in relation to social, political, economic, religious, intellectual, technological, and aesthetic developments. Attention will also be paid to how various cultural constructs affect the ways we interpret art.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: History of Art II
courses.description: This course explores the history of visual culture from a global perspective during the early modern period, ca. 1400-1850. Selected cultures from across the world will be examined in terms of their regional traditions as well as their impactful interactions with other cultures. The historical use, value, and meaning of visual images, buildings, and artifacts will be analyzed in relation to social, political, economic, religious, intellectual, technological, and aesthetic developments. Attention will also be placed on how various cultural constructs affect the ways we interpret art.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: History of Art III
courses.description: This course explores the history of visual culture from a global perspective from the onset of Modernism, ca. 1850, to the present. Selected cultures from across the world will be examined in terms of their regional traditions as well as their impactful interactions with other cultures. The historical use, value, and meaning of visual images, buildings, and artifacts will be analyzed in relation to social, political, economic, religious, intellectual, technological, and aesthetic developments. Attention will also be placed on how various cultural constructs affect the ways we interpret art.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Building Skills in Object Analysis
courses.description: This course introduces students to hands-on methods of object study and to research methods that guide the physical, contextual and interpretive analysis of fabricated objects and structures.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Freshman or Sophomore .

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Principles and Methods of Art History
courses.description: This course will critically examine the interpretive principles and methods that have been used in the discourse of art history from the Renaissance to the present day.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: History of Modern Design
courses.description: Examines the products of applied design during the past 150 years, including examples of furnishings, industrial design, fashion, and graphic design, in relation to demand, technology and production, standards, fine art, social reform, and the dynamics of consumption.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Asian Art and Culture
courses.description: Explores the diverse visual languages and cultures of Asia including the Buddhist and Hindu traditions from India and Southeast Asia, the imperial art of China with its refined taste for ceramics and painting, and the Japanese.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Art of India
courses.description: This course explores the diverse artistic traditions of the Indian subcontinent from ancient times to the modern period, focusing on the art of the Buddhist, Hindu and Islamic communities. The survey ends with an examination of the colonial, post-colonial and contemporary art scene.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Art of China
courses.description: From the first empires to modern times, this course explores the art of painting ceramics, as well as the sculptural and architectural traditions of China.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Art of Japan
courses.description: This course examines the art of Japan from the Shinto traditional forms to the creation of a Buddhist Japanese idiom, from the courtly and military art to the Zen aesthetics and the establishment of a modern urban culture.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Early Modernism (1850-1900)
courses.description: This course is an introduction to European art of the late nineteenth century, from roughly 1850 to 1900—the decades when modernism exploded. Beginning with a close look at the Realist and Impressionist movements in Paris, we will study the artistic styles, techniques, and materials characteristic of the modern era, as well as the changing social, historical and political circumstances that helped shaped artistic production.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: 20th Century Modernism (1900-1955)
courses.description: This course will critically examine the development of Modernism in Western art during the first half of the 20th century in light of socio-economic and political factors, philosophical and scientific ideas, technological developments, stylistic movements, and art theories.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Contemporary Art
courses.description: This course will survey current global art production in light of socio-economic and political factors, philosophical and scientific theories, and new approaches to media and technology.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: History of African-American Art
courses.description: This course traces the history of African American art, beginning with the African-inspired material culture of slaves, and, later, encompassing the works of formally-trained as well as self-taught painters, sculptors, photographers, and artists working in multimedia up to the present. These works will be situated within the contexts of critical race theory, social and political movements, collectors and patrons, early critics and theorists of the black avant-garde, influential exhibitions, and the opposition between elite and popular cultures.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: African Art
courses.description: This course will explore historical and contemporary African sculpture, textiles, painting, drawing, photography and mixed media in relationship to particular themes such as religion, trade, political power and healing. With emphasis on select objects from West and Central Africa, the course will also consider the visual arts in relationship to ideas of improvisation, aesthetics, identity and self-representation.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Latin American Art
courses.description: This course serves as an introduction to modern and contemporary art from Latin America. Throughout the term we chart how artists across the Americas have responded to political catalysts like revolution, imperialism, dictatorship, and globalization.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Material Matters in Contemporary Art
courses.description: This course explores how global artists since 1960 have used distinctive materials toward conceptual, political, and aesthetic purposes. Each class focuses on a material or object—whether newspaper, gold, or mirrors—in order to investigate how artists have harnessed that material’s qualities, limitations, and associations.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Ancient Greek and Roman Art
courses.description: This course will survey the art produced by the ancient cultures of Greece and Rome, from the archaic period to the fall of the Roman Empire. The art will be considered as an expression of the social, political, economic and intellectual histories of these two civilizations.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Medieval Art
courses.description: This course is a survey of Medieval Art between the 3rd and 14th centuries C.E.. Architecture, mural painting, stained glass, sculpture, illuminated manuscripts, enamel, tapestry and other objects of ceremonial and everyday use will be studied as expressions of the political, social, and religious contexts of the time. Emphasis will be placed upon Christian art, but Islamic, Jewish, and secular traditions in the arts will also be examined.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Italian Renaissance Art
courses.description: This course will survey paintings, sculpture, architecture and graphic art from Italy during the 15th and 16th centuries. Artworks will be analyzed not only in terms of their formal characteristics, but also as expressions of concurrent social, political, economic, religious, and philosophical developments.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Northern Renaissance
courses.description: This course will survey paintings, sculpture, and graphic arts from Northern Europe during the 15th and 16th centuries. Artworks will be analyzed not only in terms of their formal characteristics, but also as expressions of concurrent social, political, economic, religious, and philosophical developments.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Global Material Culture
courses.description: Understanding “global” geographically and as a method of material culture analysis, this class examines how artifacts accrue new meanings, forms, and agencies as they circulate across cultures, and the social, political, and aesthetic implications of these processes.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: History of Costume I: Preclassical to 1800
courses.description: Traces the rise of Western costume from the ancient world through 1800, including political, economic, and social influence on aesthetic development in dress.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: History of Costume II: 1800-1920
courses.description: Traces the history of costume from 1800 through 1920, including the political, economic, and social influence on aesthetic development in dress.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: History of Costume III: 1920 to Present
courses.description: Examines fashion and dress trends from 1920 through the 21st century within their sociocultural, political, and economic contexts. The course also explores how globalization, technology, and mass media impact the aesthetics of dress.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Women in Art
courses.description: A historical survey of the art created by women in Western civilization, with a special focus upon the art created since the women's movement of the 1970s. Objects are analyzed in relation to the sociopolitical and psychological context of Western, patriarchal culture.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Art History Senior Thesis
courses.description: An optional research project written during the senior year under the advisement of a thesis director from among the art history faculty. The thesis student will meet at least once every week with the advisor who will provide direction for their research by helping them to develop a topic, identify appropriate resources, discuss interpretive strategies, determine the expository structure of the paper, and provide clarity on specific requirements for bibliography, illustrations, and a citation system.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARTH 101 [Min Grade: C+] and ARTH 102 [Min Grade: C+] and ARTH 103 [Min Grade: C+] and ARTH 200 [Min Grade: C+]

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Art History Seminar
courses.description: Provides reading, discussion, and research on pertinent topics in art history.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Independent Study in Art History
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Independent Study in Art History
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: ARTH

courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: ARTH
courses.title: Special Topics in Art History
courses.description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

courses.subject: ARTH
