courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

DANC.name: Dance
DANC.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Survey of Dance Studies
courses.description: This course will include lecture, reading assignments, writing assignments and self-reflection activities to introduce students to academic dance coursework in higher education.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Yoga
courses.description: The physical and intellectual study of the ancient practice of yoga. Includes both physical practice and readings related to the discipline, as well as a survey of a variety of forms of the practice.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 12 credits

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Ballet Technique I
courses.description: Introduces ballet dance vocabulary including alignment, stretching and strengthening, line, flexibility and movement phrases.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 7 times for 16 credits

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Modern Dance Technique I
courses.description: Introduces modern dance vocabulary, including stretching and strengthening exercises, alignment, movement phrases, and basic locomotor skills. Includes performances and discussion.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 7 times for 16 credits

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Jazz Dance Technique I
courses.description: Introduces jazz dance style, concentrating on body isolations, movement vocabulary and the development of movement phrases.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 8 credits

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Hip-Hop Dance Technique I
courses.description: Introduces hip-hop dance technique, vocabulary, movement principles, muscle control, and body alignment. Includes appreciation for funk and hip-hop with historical and cultural contexts.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 8 credits

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Dance Improvisation I
courses.description: A studio course in creative movement. Uses contact and structured improvisational problems, interaction between dances and the elements of time, space and force.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 8 credits

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: African Dance Technique I
courses.description: This studio course is designed to explore the aesthetic, movement, music and rituals found in African Dance forms.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 8 credits

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Philadelphia Dance, Let’s Go!
courses.description: Philadelphia Dance Let's Go! exposes students to a variety of dance performance opportunities available in the Philadelphia region. Through research, discussion, and attendance at dance productions, students will enhance their abilities to discuss, evaluate and enjoy dance.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Introduction to Dance
courses.description: A studio and classroom course. Examines the elements of dance through study and participation in classical, theatrical, and social forms. Includes readings, films, and discussion.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Dance and Fitness
courses.description: This course explores areas of health, fitness and wellness, including nutrition, cardiovascular health, strength training, flexibility, psychological wellness, and injury prevention. Topics will be covered through a combination of kinesthetic and academic approaches.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Foundations of Somatic Theory and Practice
courses.description: This course, for beginner through advanced, teaches you to maximize your potential for dance, sports, yoga, martial arts or any movement practice, through readings, exercises and assignments that build core strength, flexibility and efficient action.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Dance Practicum in Performance
courses.description: Provides practical experience as a dancer in a Department of Performing Arts dance production. Includes helping with preperformance production, attending all rehearsals, and performing in the concerts. May be repeated for credit.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Dance Practicum in Production
courses.description: Provides practical experience in dance production, including participation in publicity, costume construction, lighting design, box office, and program production for a Drexel University Dance Ensemble concert. May be repeated for credit.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Dance Practicum in Choreography
courses.description: Covers the process of developing an idea into a finished dance through close work with the artistic director, including selecting dancers and music; teaching the movement; planning costumes, lighting, and sets; polishing the work; and presenting it to an audience during a Drexel University Dance Ensemble concert. May be repeated for credit.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Rhythmic Study for Dance
courses.description: Covers rhythmic structures that can accompany dance, including sight reading and eurhythmics.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Ballet Technique II
courses.description: Studio course in intermediate level ballet technique. Further develops students' alignment, line, muscular stamina, flexibility, movement vocabulary and artistry.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 7 times for 16 credits
courses.prerequisites: DANC 104 [Min Grade: D] or DANC 140 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Modern Dance Technique II
courses.description: Covers advanced modern dance vocabulary including stretching and strengthening exercises, alignment, movement phrases and performance quality.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 7 times for 16 credits
courses.prerequisites: DANC 105 [Min Grade: D] or DANC 150 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Jazz Dance Technique II
courses.description: Covers advanced jazz dance style, concentrating on body isolations, movement vocabulary, and the development of movement phrases, syncopation and flexibility.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 8 credits
courses.prerequisites: DANC 106 [Min Grade: D] or DANC 160 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Hip-Hop Dance Technique II
courses.description: Advanced hip-hop dance technique, vocabulary, movement principles, muscle control, and body alignment. Includes appreciation for funk and hip-hop with historical and cultural contexts.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 8 credits
courses.prerequisites: DANC 107 [Min Grade: D] or DANC 170 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Dance Improvisation II
courses.description: A studio course in advanced creative movement. Uses improvisational problems and improvisational dance making to study momentum, speed, alignment, contact, sound, group work, and dramatic intention.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: DANC 108 [Min Grade: D] or DANC 180 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: African Dance Technique II
courses.description: This studio course is an advanced exploration of the aesthetic, movement, music and rituals found in African Dance forms. It builds on principles of African I and introduces more complex and physically demanding repertory.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 8 credits
courses.prerequisites: DANC 109 [Min Grade: D] or DANC 190 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Dance Appreciation
courses.description: Teaches students to look at dance as an art form, emphasizing the ability to analyze and understand various dance styles. Includes films, readings, performances, and discussion.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: DANC 115 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Introduction to Laban Movement Analysis
courses.description: This course introduces the principles of movement analysis by Rudolph Von Laban including an exploration of effort - shape, space and body as introduced by physical therapist Irmgard Bartenieff.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Survey of Dance and Movement Therapy
courses.description: This course investigates the use of dance as a diagnostic and therapeutic tool for psychological health and recovery.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Dance Pedagogy
courses.description: This course explores the social and physical development of children as it relates to the teaching of dance. Develops a repertoire of techniques for teaching children and adults.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Dance Pedagogy I: Foundations of Dance Pedagogy
courses.description: This course explores the theoretical foundations for dance teaching and learning. Teaching methodologies and practices will be developed through academic and embodied coursework.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Dance Repertory
courses.description: This course allows dancers to synthesize their technical abilities with their knowledge of dance history as they learn the works of major historical choreographers.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 6 credits

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Dance Composition I
courses.description: Explores the basic traditional forms of solo and group composition through improvisation, manipulation of movement phrases and critique.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Screendance
courses.description: This course is a practical introduction to Screendance for dancemakers interested in extending their experience in dance into a new technological realm. Screendance connects film (and filmmaking) with dance (and dancemaking) in an evolving hybrid performative practice. Through creative projects, students will develop their cinematic style and increase proficiency with both filming and editing movement.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Injury Prevention for Dance
courses.description: This course uses physical and intellectual exploration to create individual flexibility and injury prevention plans that meet the student's goals. It is particularly targeted to dancers who use their bodies intensively. Techniques for injury prevention and recovery are emphasized.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Ballet Dance Technique III
courses.description: Studio course in advanced level ballet technique. Further develops students' alignment, line, muscular stamina, flexibility, movement vocabulary, artistry and critical analysis of ballet movement.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 7 times for 16 credits
courses.prerequisites: DANC 204 [Min Grade: D] or DANC 141 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Modern Dance Technique III
courses.description: This course covers advanced modern dance vocabulary, including stretching and strengthening exercises, alignment principles, movement phrases, and increasingly complex locomotor skills.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 7 times for 16 credits
courses.prerequisites: DANC 205 [Min Grade: D] or DANC 151 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Jazz Dance Technique III
courses.description: This course covers advanced jazz dance styles for highly experienced students, concentrating on body isolations, movement vocabulary and the development of movement phrases, syncopation and flexibility.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 8 credits
courses.prerequisites: DANC 206 [Min Grade: D] or DANC 161 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Hip- Hop Technique Class III
courses.description: Advanced Hip-Hop choreography & dance technique, movement principles, muscle control, and body alignment. Hip-Hop III includes exploring choreographic phrases and compositions like those featured in music videos, movies, and other professional presentations of Hip Hop dance.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
courses.prerequisites: DANC 207 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: African Technique Class III
courses.description: This studio course is designed to explore, embody and create through projects the aesthetic, movement, music, and cultural rituals found in African dance forms.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: DANC 209 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Twentieth Century Dance
courses.description: Covers the history of Western theatrical dance from the beginning of the century to contemporary times. Emphasizes the development of modern dance in the United States. Includes films, performances, and discussion. This is a writing intensive course.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Dance Kinesiology
courses.description: This course will provide an introduction to the musculoskeletal system and basic health information. Students will gain an understanding of anatomy and kinesiology and will explore how these topics are related to dance, normal daily activities, injury prevention, and healthy lifestyle choices. The kinesiological concepts presented in this course will be applied using the context of dance movement.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Dance Pedagogy II: Dance Education for Children and Youth
courses.description: This course explores the theoretical and practical issues surrounding dance teaching and learning for children and youth in PK-8, private studio and community engaged settings.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Dance Composition II
courses.description: This course explores the advanced forms of solo or group choreography including narrative, abstract and musical interactions.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits
courses.prerequisites: DANC 235 [Min Grade: D] or DANC 240 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Dance Aesthetics and Criticism
courses.description: This course is designed to introduce students to the concepts of aesthetics which affect the ways in which dance in created, performed and viewed. Issues of dance criticism and how this pertains to aesthetic judgment will also be addressed.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: DANC 215 [Min Grade: D] or DANC 201 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Survey of Somatic Practices
courses.description: This course investigates a range of integrative mind/body practices for physical well-being and optimal performance.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: (DANC 316 [Min Grade: D] or DANC 360 [Min Grade: D]) and (DANC 117 [Min Grade: D] or DANC 261 [Min Grade: D])

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Dance Pedagogy III: Dance Education for Adolescents and Adults
courses.description: This course explores the theoretical and practical issues surrounding dance teaching and learning for adolescents, adults and senior adults in secondary education, private studio and community engaged settings.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Senior Seminar in Dance
courses.description: Senior Seminar prepares graduating Dance students for a successful transition after graduation and provide strategies to contribute to the field of dance. This course will also prepare students for a culminating senior project experience.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DANC
courses.title: Senior Project in Dance
courses.description: Senior Project is the capstone course for Dance Majors in which the student presents a project in one of three areas: a presentation, scholarly research paper, or a major performance. The students will be required to utilize the skills, techniques, and concepts that they learned prior to their senior year in Drexel's Dance Program and present a project that reflects the students’ strength, concentration, and passion.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 3 credits
courses.prerequisites: DANC 481 [Min Grade: D]

courses.title: Independent Study in Dance
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.

DSMR.name: Design & Merchandising
DSMR.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Computer Imaging I
courses.description: The course explores the fundamentals of computer design software including Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign. Projects include graphics creation and manipulation; image acquisition, text creation and manipulation; typography; input and output options and control; hardware/software/system fundamentals; and troubleshooting as they relate to the creative industries.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Introduction to the Fashion Industry
courses.description: Introduces the materials and methods used to design, develop, and market the fashion product, including current vocabulary and foundation of knowledge about industry practices and career opportunities.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Analysis of Product
courses.description: This course examines the product development process from concept to consumer. Students will analyze the global supply chain and learn about sustainable product strategies.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Presentation Techniques Design and Merchandising
courses.description: In Presentation Techniques students learn the various types of presentations used within a professional workplace environment. Students learn methods and practice public speaking, storytelling, rhetoric, and digital design skills to create slide decks, white papers, and short videos related to a relevant prompt specific to the fashion lifestyle industry.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: (VSST 102 [Min Grade: D] or VSST 105 [Min Grade: D]) and (VSCM 100 [Min Grade: D] or DSMR 100 [Min Grade: D] or WEST 100 [Min Grade: D]) and DSMR 211 [Min Grade: D] and COM 230 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Digital Design for Design and Merchandising
courses.description: This course builds skills and processes in using digital design tools and industry research and their application in the development of a range of merchandising presentations. Students learn to use an array of Adobe Creative Suite tools, trend intelligence and retail analytics to present curated, balanced, and strategic product offerings.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 100 [Min Grade: D] or DSMR 100 [Min Grade: D] or WEST 100 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Digital Commerce & Promotion
courses.description: The Internet has changed nearly every aspect of how lifestyle brands operate in the 21st century. Digital marketing, social media, and e-commerce have become crucial to merchandising fashion apparel, accessories, home fashion and beauty business growth. In this course students will gain a deeper understanding of how the digital economy works, and they will develop the critical insights necessary to design a brand strategy to succeed in e-commerce, digital, and social media marketing.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Textiles for Design and Merchandising
courses.description: Examines the textile manufacturing industry and the fundamental processes involved in producing natural and man-made fabrics as they relate to Design & Merchandising. Includes basic terminology and production processes as well as selection and evaluation of fabrics based on aesthetics, performance and care characteristics.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is DSMR.

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Retail Operations
courses.description: Examines retail philosophies within an operational context, including understanding how consumption, present and future, determines a retailer's strategy.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Merchandise Planning and Buying
courses.description: Provides a working knowledge of merchandise planning, flow, and distribution in the retail setting. Covers profitable merchandise and assortment planning and control in both conceptual and technical formats. Final project incorporates six-month financial, classification, and assortment planning.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: DSMR 231 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Branding and Retail Strategies
courses.description: Students will perform an in-depth analysis of theoretical and applied retail product and brand research. Qualitative, quantitative and triangulation methods of research will be discussed. The course focuses on researching, writing and presenting various topics in a professional environment.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Design and Merchandising Trends and Impact
courses.description: An exploration of a specialized area of the industry which is relevant to the zeitgeist.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 12 times for 39 credits
courses.prerequisites: DSMR 231 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Merchandising Operations & Management
courses.description: This course will focus on the apparel & non-apparel management functions that exist between the merchandising, design, production and promotion elements of the product supply chain. Students will utilize retail analytics, trend intelligence, excel applications and assortment and allocation planning to execute merchandising strategies, sales plans and margin goals.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: DSMR 232 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Visual Merchandising
courses.description: Visual Merchandising combines design skills, consumer psychology and marketing principles to create window displays, floor merchandising and plan-o-grams in a retail environment that entices consumers to buy. Students will investigate related areas of store planning and design, point-of-purchase display, fixture design, and topics on trend in the industry. Students will apply the principles and elements of design in merchandise presentation, analysis and experimentation and field research. Methods of promoting and selling merchandise, analyzing leading retail firms, employing basic methods of displaying merchandise, and developing a basic understanding of the use of special materials and lighting will be integrated into experiential projects outside of the classroom.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: DSMR 232 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Media Merchandising I
courses.description: In Media Merchandising I students learn the process of creating, designing, and publishing a digital publication. The students develop all content organized around themes of school, city, fashion, product, and technology, and the various intersections as it relates to design and merchandising.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits
courses.prerequisites: VSST 103 [Min Grade: D] and DSMR 210 [Min Grade: D] and DSMR 211 [Min Grade: D] and ENGL 103 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Media Merchandising II
courses.description: Media Merchandising II is a continuation of Media Merchandising I, where students learn to engage in strategic decision making related to digital content such as, informational articles, interviews, photography, graphic design, social media, interactive media and paid advertisement. The results of the student’s learning process is a premier fashion lifestyle digital publication.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits
courses.prerequisites: DSMR 315 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Beauty Merchandising & Marketing
courses.description: Learn how beauty products are developed, merchandised, packaged and marketed. This course will cover the history of the industry, iconic brands, and walk through the process of product ideation, development/testing, merchandising and distribution. Students will understand the importance of packaging and presentation.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 4 times for 15 credits

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Fashion Show Production I
courses.description: This course is an examination of the Fashion Show as a sales and marketing tool and as a historically important event in the evolution of the fashion industry. An understanding of all behind-the-scenes aspects of a professional fashion show will be discussed. This course introduces a hands-on experience in addition to academic course work. Especially for students interested in event planning, public relations and marketing, this course provides experience that will be valuable as students enter the workplace.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Retail Intersections: Social & Cultural Issues
courses.description: Those who participate in the business of fashion such as retailers, merchants, designers, manufacturers and stylists must evolve in order to sell to customers. Throughout their lives, students are exposed to retailing, merchandising, buying, design, sales, branding, promotions, manufacturing and other such fields. For those interested in the study of retailing, fashion and merchandising, it is essential to understand landmark research and theoretical concepts behind the influences of this field and how social change, innovations and with the evolution of a multicultural marketplace, shifts have occurred over generations, and into the 21st century. This conceptual and theoretical course will expose students to a diverse range of clients and consumers.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: DSMR 231 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Immersive Media and Merchandising
courses.description: This multi-discipline course is bringing together brand strategy & merchandising (D&M) with the immersive media experience of the Digital Media program. Students will explore digital solutions for the business of fashion and develop solutions using immersive media in virtual & real space. Groups will combine students from Design and Merchandising & Digital Media to explore opportunities to plan and implement immersive solutions specific to the textile, fashion, and lifestyle industries.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 12 times for 39 credits
courses.prerequisites: DSMR 310 [Min Grade: C] or ENTP 440 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Product Styling for Digital Commerce
courses.description: Styling is the practice of visual communication from briefs for a particular aesthetic for large-scale photo shoots, product photography or flat-lays. These skills are applicable skills for product styling, and photography styling for ecommerce, covering the latest in design trends; practical case studies and expert styling tips, tricks and advice. Student teams will combine their knowledge of photography and merchandising to understand and execute photo shoots for a broad range of ecommerce categories including apparel, beauty, footwear, jewelry, home décor, food, and electronics. The course with culminate with a photoshoot; conceptualized and created from start to finish.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 4 times for 15 credits

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Fashion Product Development and Sourcing
courses.description: Provides an overview of the development of knitted and woven, apparel and non-apparel products. The execution of line development will include market research, sourcing, costing, markup planning and category analysis. Students will evaluate global supply chains and circularity using product lifecycle management technology.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: DSMR 231 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Career Strategies for Design and Merchandising
courses.description: Course develops skills that enable the student to put into place an effective job search strategy. Specifically geared to the D&M professions, students develop comprehensive area of expertise including networking, industry research, and industry hiring trends.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Senior.

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Merchandising Analytics
courses.description: An integral part of today’s retail environment is data analytics. This real-world data-driven course highlights a variety of critical retail metrics and analyses that will demonstrate and support the importance of being a data-driven decision-making business. The course will utilize technology to enhance the understanding of the use of data to make key business decisions in retail buying and planning.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: DSMR 310 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Design and Merchandising in the Circular Economy
courses.description: This course will examine the sustainability of the fashion system from concept to consumer. Topics will include new technologies, sourcing and supply chains, business models, consumer behavior, and new roles and opportunities within the fashion system that support a circular economy.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Design and Merchandising Seminar
courses.description: Provides reading and discussion of pertinent topics of current concern in the professional area of design and merchandising.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is DSMR. Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Retail and Merchandising Seminar Leadership
courses.description: This course will be taught in a seminar format and feature talks from various leadership areas in the retail, merchandising, and lifestyle product areas. Topics will consider how managers and leaders must develop teams to understand corporate culture, retail management & analysis, product quality, customer service, human resources, merchandising strategies, and future goals.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Senior Problem in Design and Merchandising
courses.description: Provides an opportunity for the student to research, independently or within a group, an idea within the field of design-merchandising, synthesizing material and developing a presentation of that concept.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PROD 215 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Senior.

courses.subject: DSMR
courses.title: Independent Study in Design & Merchandising
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

DIGM.name: Digital Media
DIGM.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DIGM
courses.title: Digital Design Tools
courses.description: Students learn the basics of visual design within the digital realm. Software tools such as Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator are utilized.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DIGM
courses.title: Overview of Digital Media
courses.description: Surveys the history, theory, practice, technologies, and related social issues associated with the growth of digital media.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DIGM
courses.title: Introduction to Scripting for the Digital Content Creation Pipeline
courses.description: This course introduces fundamental scripting concepts through the exploration of modern scripting languages commonly used in disciplines related to digital content creation (DCC) pipelines.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DIGM
courses.title: Professional Practices
courses.description: Provides a professional orientation to the field through an exploration of a variety of digital media projects. In addition to lecture and discussions, allows students to take active part in role plays and presentations to achieve an understanding of the importance of team building, team work, and team management in all phases of digital media production from proposals to product delivery.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: DIGM
courses.title: Digital Cultural Heritage
courses.description: Digital Cultural Heritage is a growing pursuit including Digital Media, Digital Humanities, Computer Science, and Archeology. It has components in academic research, museology, tourism, economic development as well as new media technology development and applications. This class will investigate this emerging and exciting field and explore its possibilities in the context of Philadelphia’s cultural heritage.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: DIGM
courses.title: Digital Storytelling
courses.description: By surfing the internet and playing computer games, by lectures, assigned readings, class screening, and research projects, this class explores the impact of digital media on art, design and daily living.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: DIGM
courses.title: Explorations in New Media
courses.description: Through class presentations, field trips, discussions, readings, screenings and guest speakers; this class bridges artistic and technical aspects of new media in theory and practice.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: DIGM
courses.title: Seminar: The Future of Digital Media
courses.description: Focuses on current and anticipated issues in digital media. Involves reading and discussion of news, product announcements, articles, and predictions related to digital media. Provides a comprehensive and up-to-date understanding of digital media, including its likely directions in the immediate future and long-term possibilities.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 371 [Min Grade: D] (Can be taken Concurrently) or DIGM 451 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: DIGM
courses.title: Digital Media Senior Project
courses.description: In this course students produce professional-level media assets for a team based senior project in a simulated real-world production environment. It requires a project that demonstrates the integration of the academic and practical knowledge the student has acquired in the overall field as well as in one or more specializations. Students will refine their understanding of the production, delivery and presentation of quality digital media production through implementation of professional best practices, and practice and perfect written, oral, and visual presentation skills through the power of collaboration, teamwork and shared missions.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits
courses.prerequisites: (ANIM 378 [Min Grade: D] or GMAP 377 [Min Grade: D] or IDM 372 [Min Grade: D] or VRIM 320 [Min Grade: D]) and (DIGM 451 [Min Grade: D] or DIGM 475 [Min Grade: D])

courses.subject: DIGM
courses.title: Digital Media Senior Project Studio
courses.description: In this course Digital Media senior project teams will meet with an appointed advisor on the technical details of their specific project requirements.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 3 credits

courses.subject: DIGM
courses.title: Independent Study in Digital Media
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

EAM.name: Entertainment & Arts Management
EAM.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Overview of Entertainment and Arts Management
courses.description: Students acquire an understanding of the profit and non-profit organization within a social and governmental context. Of primary focus are the arts organization as an entity, how they are organized and the impact and place they have within the community.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Introduction to the Music Industry
courses.description: Introduction to the Music Industry gives students a basic overview of the commercial music business with an emphasis on its inherently changing nature and the entrepreneurial mindset that this demands of those involved in it. The goal of the course is to provide a basic introduction to four major areas of the industry: Contracts, Publishing, Touring & Booking, and Recording.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 130 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Strategic Management for Entertainment and Arts Management
courses.description: Explores the concepts of planning and evaluation as it relates to the arts. Instruction will focus on the development of business plans, including research, organization, competition, marketing, staffing, and financial issues (i.e. budgets, etc.). Students present and defend the elements of their plans. Other topics discussed will be leadership skills decision-making, and managing change.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Writing for Arts Managers
courses.description: This course provides instruction and practice in a variety of written formats used in arts and entertainment. The course also covers writing for a variety of stakeholders.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 130 [Min Grade: D] and EAM 211 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Law for Entertainment and Arts Management Managers
courses.description: Examines the relationship between the arts and law, including intellectual property (copyrights and contracts), license fees, labor-management and representation agreements, liability, first amendment issues, business entities and fundraising.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 211 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Copyrights and Trademarks
courses.description: This law course for EAM students discusses topics relating to copyrights, intellectual property rights, and royalties. The course will review the basic principal tenets of copyright and trademark law and the practical aspects as applied to entertainment and arts-related issues. This course will provide you with a working knowledge of trademarks and copyrights and how these rights impact business issues in the arena of entertainment and art such as how copyright and trademark rights are created and protected, “work for hire” and related ownership issues, and how and when copyright and trademark rights are infringed.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 220 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Financial Management for Entertainment & Arts Managers
courses.description: This course explores the major elements of financial accounting in cultural institutions. Students will learn to perform accounting tasks, read and analyze financial statements, implement an effective financial control system in the specific context of arts & cultural organizations. Student will learn how to use financial information as part of a data-informed decision-making process.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 211 [Min Grade: D] and EAM 130 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Audience Development for Arts
courses.description: This course emphasizes the usefulness and application of marketing theories and concepts to develop audiences and promotes the arts as a valuable social sector, with a focus on marketing planning and strategy development. Focus is placed on marketing research, analysis, planning, strategy development, and development of marketing plans.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 211 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: eSport Entertainment Management
courses.description: As one of the fastest growing market sectors in electronic media, eSport has become an important field where entertainment management students can apply their skills. This 3-credit course explores the creation, monetization and management of eSport events.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Streaming Entertainment Management
courses.description: Streaming is transforming the electronic media landscape and providing unique opportunities for managers. This course explores the creative genres succeeding in streaming and how streaming content is conceived, sold, produced, exhibited, and distributed worldwide.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Gallery and Collection Management
courses.description: Discusses the professional operation of museums and commercial art galleries including advocacy, legal, administration, curatorial, exhibition, and public issues by examining the questions: What are the challenges of managing a museum's collection including acquisition policies, insurance, conservation and storage of art? What resources are needed to manage a gallery?.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Exhibition Design
courses.description: Discuss key issues in exhibition presentation including visual design elements, accessibility, and approachable presentation strategies. This course also explores theoretical and ethical issues related to museums, art collecting, cultural patrimony, curatorial authority, and diversity.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Entertainment Promotion and Branding
courses.description: This course will provide students in-depth information about the essential area of publicity and promotion for the entertainment and arts industries. Through the art of public relations (PR), students will learn to maximize the potential for news coverage in print, electronic (radio, TV) and online sources. Focus will be placed on the process of writing for public relations and promotion in both style and content. By writing multiple drafts of biographies, press releases, pitch letters, students will hone skills to creatively present your message to media outlets, from local to international.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 211 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Social Media in Entertainment
courses.description: Social Media In Entertainment teaches students how to develop the strategies for using social media as a marketing tool in the arts and entertainment industries. The goal will be to develop a social media strategy for a specific entity utilizing information on strategies and tactics learned during the course, as well as how to integrate this strategy into an overall marketing plan. Students will learn how to craft a strategy, how to evaluate which social media tools and tactics to use to achieve the most effective results and how to successfully implement the strategy.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Introduction to Fund Development for the Arts
courses.description: This course will provide an introduction to the fundraising process and initial training needs for current and future nonprofit arts organization managers. The focus is a blend of theory and practice in the areas of fund development process, organization, and communication; the primary goal is to prepare students for successfully working with or in nonprofit arts organizations in development / fundraising capacities. Our work will cover: basic sources of funding including online fundraising; board / trustee fiduciary responsibilities; trends, ethics, and innovation in fund development.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 130 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Volunteer and Board Management
courses.description: This course continues the work of EAM 312- Intro to Fund Development for the Arts. It will build on that course by focusing on the area of volunteers for nonprofit organizations. Content will examine the board of directors and other volunteers in relation to governing, managing, operating a nonprofit arts entity.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 130 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Content Strategies for Digital Products
courses.description: In this course students will understand content strategy and its business value, as well as how to audit, plan, create, deliver and manage content that effectively promotes a brand message across multiple digital channels.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 211 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Box Office and Venue Management
courses.description: Focuses on the operational management tasks. Students explore the marketing and promotional component of box office management, the use of technology and ticket sales, and managing people.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 211 [Min Grade: D] and EAM 130 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Performing Arts Touring
courses.description: Performing Arts Touring provides an overview of organizing all types of touring entertainment with a focus on the administrative and management responsibilities including booking, staffing, and decision making. Focus is placed two basic types of touring: music concert tours and performing arts tours such as Broadway shows, ballet companies, small theatrical tours, and similar arts tours. Students learn about unions, contracts, financing, logistics, promotion, ticketing, and other areas associated with arts and entertainment touring.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 130 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Producing for Live Entertainment
courses.description: This course is experience-based and designed to familiarize students with all aspects of producing a live entertainment event and to discuss and develop the necessary skills to do so successfully through practical experience. The course provides an overview of the issues routinely encountered by producers of live events, both commercial and non-profit, through the actual producing of an arts/entertainment event. Skills developed include working creatively with artists; understanding project management, planning and budgeting; revenue projection and management (including possible fundraising); understanding technical and logistical issues around production; and successful execution.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits
courses.prerequisites: EAM 130 [Min Grade: D] and EAM 211 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Entertainment Enterprise
courses.description: This course challenges students to learn how to conceive, plan, build and evaluate an entertainment/media business. Expanding upon information about business ideation and formulation, this course provides students with a learning lab where they can apply theory to practice in entertainment, arts and media enterprises.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 211 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Artist Representation and Management
courses.description: This course gives an introduction to artist representation in the entertainment and media industry. It will cover all aspects of representation including client selection, career management and strategy for artists, agent/managers’ roles and managing your career. The course covers how the industry works both conceptually and politically. Discussions will include topics around the major entertainment companies, their work and focus, and how they compete. The course breaks down the industry into “revenue silos” in which a client can generate money.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 130 [Min Grade: D] and EAM 211 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Media and Entertainment Business
courses.description: This course focuses on media networks and other major players in the media and entertainment business, examining their interdependence, and discussing major trends and tendencies on the market and their impact on the art and entertainment field.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Arts, Culture and Society
courses.description: Arts, Culture & Society examines the role of art’s impact on society, exploring key cultural and public policy issues including community standards and censorship, and different approaches to public support and funding. Readings, videos, discussions and projects will explore questions as to the social functions of the arts, the use of art for advocacy and patronage over the world, and the impact of art on society and economic development. The geographic focus of this course is global and will compare art, including commercial entertainment and the media, and cultural practices and impacts from various cultures around the world.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 130 [Min Grade: D] and EAM 211 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Human Resources in the Creative Industries
courses.description: This course is designed to give students an overview of the human resources field and to share the many ways that the creative industries conform to and diverge from human resources norms that stem from other fields. In addition to equipping students with a general understanding of how to engage with and manage staff, this course will help students become better stewards of their own careers within the industry.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 211 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: EAM
courses.title: Senior Seminar
courses.description: This course serves as the finale of the student’s undergraduate education. Applying all the skills and principles learned at Drexel, each student builds a customized career toolkit and practices essential real-world skills during hands-on scenario exercises. A student may also choose to execute an independent senior capstone project as part of Senior Seminar.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EAM 422 [Min Grade: D]

courses.title: Independent Study in Entertainment & Arts Management
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

EVGD.name: Environmental Graphic Design
EVGD.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: EVGD
courses.title: Introduction to Environmental Graphic Design
courses.description: This course is an introduction to the Environmental Graphic Design specialty including wayfinding systems, architectural graphics, signage, exhibit design, and mapped and themed environments.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 230 [Min Grade: D] and VSCM 240 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is GRDS.

courses.subject: EVGD
courses.title: Wayfinding
courses.description: This course explores the discipline of wayfinding in an urban environment through the use of visual clues and directional hierarchy, including typography, symbols, and color.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is GRDS.

courses.subject: EVGD
courses.title: Exhibit Design
courses.description: This exploration of exhibit design focuses on communicating a narrative visually through the design of space, graphics, objects, and interactivity.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 230 [Min Grade: D] and VSCM 240 [Min Grade: D] and EVGD 200 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is GRDS.

courses.subject: EVGD
courses.title: Environmental Branding
courses.description: This course explores the marketing power of a branded identity when it is visually and spatially applied to a retail environment.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: EVGD 320 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is GRDS.

courses.subject: EVGD
courses.title: Independent Study in EVGD
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

FASH.name: Fashion Design
FASH.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Sustainable Practice in Fashion
courses.description: Introduction to responsible/ sustainable practices for ethical design, development and marketing of fashion product. Course includes the exploration of global and regional markets engaged in these practices.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Fashion and Culture
courses.description: This course delves into the exploration of the social and psychological dimensions of appearance and the human body, shedding light on their role in shaping hierarchies of privilege and power within the realm of fashion design. By examining the significance of appearance, rooted in the body, through the lens of social and critical theory, we unravel how it interconnects with the principles, conduct, and standards of fashion design. Through the application of these theoretical frameworks, we probe into various subject positions to gain insights into the current landscape of fashion design. This course equips students with the knowledge to inspire transformative change throughout the fashion industry.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Fashion Drawing I
courses.description: This course examines the fashion figure, silhouette, proportion, movement and exaggerated expression using a range of live models. Emphasis of artistic style is encouraged.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSST 111 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Fashion Drawing II
courses.description: Examines fashion forms, fabrication, and conceptual design through the use of color and mixed media. Works toward the development of a personal "fashion look" and an understanding of drawing as it relates to the fashion industry. Includes live model.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 211 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Textile Science for Fashion Design
courses.description: Examines textile manufacturing and sustainable practices within the industry. Basic textile terminology and production processes are introduced including aesthetics, performance and care characteristics.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Construction Skills
courses.description: Develops a proficiency in basic garment construction. Emphasizes facility with industrial equipment. Introduces production techniques and an overall awareness of standards of quality.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Materials Exploration
courses.description: This course examines the relationship of fibers, processes and textile creation and form as it relates to the body.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSST 103 [Min Grade: D] or VSST 106 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Visual Communication in Fashion
courses.description: Introduces digital skills and presentation techniques used for communication in the fashion industry. Students will be introduced to research–based design practice.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: (VSST 102 [Min Grade: D] or VSST 105 [Min Grade: D]) and (FASH 200 [Min Grade: D] or DSMR 103 [Min Grade: D])

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Surface Design for Textiles
courses.description: Investigates traditional and digital techniques of surface design. This course explores aesthetics, color theory, motif development and layout for use in multiple fashion categories.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSST 102 [Min Grade: D] or VSST 105 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Fashion Portfolio I
courses.description: Requires the creation of a portfolio of original designs executed in a medium of choice. Explores various market segments of the industry and includes project reviews by critics who are specialists in these areas.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 313 [Min Grade: D] or FASH 318 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Computer Aided Design for Patternmaking
courses.description: Develops skills in digital patternmaking, grading and marker-making. Process is tested with a muslin prototype and a final garment.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 342 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Technical Design for Industry
courses.description: Fashion data visualization for use in the design and manufacturing of fashion product. Students create accurate flat sketches, line sheets and detailed technical packs for product life cycle management.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 309 [Min Grade: D] or FASH 310 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Fashion Design in 3-D Space
courses.description: Students explore clo 3-D virtual garment simulation. Draping directly on the avatar, individual designs are realized through a zero-waste process. Material properties are tested on the avatar in motion.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 318 [Min Grade: D] or FASH 316 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Advanced Fashion Design in 3-D Space
courses.description: This is an advanced level of Fashion Design in 3D Space. Students will work on special 3D Fashion projects and/or a self-directed project.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits
courses.prerequisites: FASH 319 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Virtual Costume Design
courses.description: Using 3D virtual design software, students create historic and futuristic 3D costume design to enhance a virtual story. Through historical costume research students will learn how to use costume design to develop narrative. This course is open to students across the University.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: History of Costume I: Preclassical to 1800
courses.description: Traces the rise of Western costume from the ancient world through 1800, including political, economic, and social influence on aesthetic development in dress. This is a writing intensive course.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: History of Costume II: 1800-1920
courses.description: Traces the history of costume from 1800 through 1920, including the political, economic, and social influence on aesthetic development in dress. This is a writing intensive course.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: History of Costume III: 1920 to Present
courses.description: Examines fashion and dress trends from 1920 through the 21st century within their sociocultural, political, and economic contexts. The course also explores how globalization, technology, and mass media impact the aesthetics of dress.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Patternmaking I
courses.description: Explores basic patternmaking techniques and manipulations and establishes comparisons between drafting and draping techniques in the development of standard slopers.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 241 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Patternmaking II
courses.description: Advances the skills of FASH 341. Includes an introduction to basic draping and how to translate on to paper.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 341 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Tailoring
courses.description: Provides intensive investigation of materials and construction techniques used in tailoring. Uses a combination of garment production methods, including a strong emphasis on couture practices.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 342 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Fashion Design I: Fabric to Form
courses.description: Exploring unconventional sources for design research, students use problem solving in design to take concepts from 2-D to 3-D with an emphasis on materials.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: (VSST 304 [Min Grade: D] or FASH 304 [Min Grade: D]) and FASH 342 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Fashion Design II: Knitwear
courses.description: Survey of knitwear design development includes yarn identification and knitted structures. Students apply hands-on digital knitting technology with SES APEX software and Shima Seiki electronic knitting machines in the design process.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 348 [Min Grade: D] or FASH 349 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Fashion Design III: Sustainable Design
courses.description: Using responsible eco-friendly concepts, students design original collections for men’s and women’s wear. Zero waste design, up-cycling and de-reconstruction methods are considered in the circular design process.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 353 [Min Grade: D] or FASH 350 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Fashion Design IV: Collection Research & Development
courses.description: Expands and broadens technical skills and lays the groundwork for development of the senior thesis collection. This includes design research and prototype development.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 354 [Min Grade: D] or FASH 351 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Couture Techniques
courses.description: Expands and broadens technical skills and lays the groundwork for development of the senior collection. Includes couture evening wear techniques and research processes.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 351 [Min Grade: D] or FASH 354 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Machine Knitting
courses.description: Machine Knitting is an introduction to knitwear design specialization. Students learn to style and draw knit garments to develop a professional portfolio. Technical information regarding yarn analysis, stitch construction, pattern and garment construction are the focus of this class.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 12 credits
courses.prerequisites: FASH 241 [Min Grade: D] and (VSST 112 [Min Grade: D] or VSST 113 [Min Grade: D])
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is FASH.

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Accessory Design
courses.description: This course provides students with concepts and skills to design traditional and contemporary fashion accessories with emphasis in embroidery; applique; hand painting; and clay, plastic and ceramic work.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 241 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Intimate Apparel Design
courses.description: This course will offer an introduction to the foundations and sleepwear marketplace. Primary focus will be on the design and execution of two pieces for this market. Students will learn how to construct a bra (molded cups) and how to incorporate these details into their final looks for this market. In addition, students will learn the safe operation of the specialty sewing machines for knit construction.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 251 [Min Grade: D] or FASH 349 [Min Grade: D] or FASH 348 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Advanced Machine Knitting
courses.description: Advanced Machine Knitting is a further exploration into the software and machinery used in knit product production. Students will participate in all stages of product development from yarn and stitch selection, swatch sampling, gauge analysis, pattern writing, knitting output, and assembly methods.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits
courses.prerequisites: FASH 450 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Fashion Portfolio II
courses.description: This course will involve research, development and execution of a finished fashion design portfolio. Students will create a physical and electronic portfolio for the global marketplace.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 314 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is FASH and classification is Senior.

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Business of Fashion
courses.description: Presents the following topics in seminar fashion merchandising, retail distribution, interpreting consumer demand, merchandise assortment planning, unit and inventory control and pricing, fashion marketing and manufacturing, including the marketing process, components of the fashion industry, market evaluation, demographic and psychological factors, manufacturing components and processes, and case studies.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is FASH and classification is Senior.

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Collection I
courses.description: The second of a three-part series in which the student develops the senior collection. Requires the student to demonstrate the synthesis of a personal aesthetic and technical acumen.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 352 [Min Grade: D] or FASH 355 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Senior.

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Collection II
courses.description: Requires completion of senior collection and presentation in student fashion show.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FASH 491 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: FASH
courses.title: Independent Study in Fashion Design
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: FASH

courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
