FMTV.name: Film & TV Production
FMTV.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Visual Storytelling
courses.description: This course explores a variety of techniques and principles used to tell stories visually. We will begin by asking, “What is a story and how might we differentiate a story told in images and sounds from one told in writing?” We will then investigate how techniques of cinematography, editing, and mise-en-scène contribute to the exposition of a story and to the articulations of its meaning.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Production Safety
courses.description: This course introduces first-year students to safety policy and protocols to be followed for all Cinema & Television production courses.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Basic Cinematography
courses.description: An introduction to the basics of photography and lighting for film and video production through demonstrations, lectures, screenings and hands-on use of digital video and still cameras and lighting equipment.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Basic Editing
courses.description: Theoretical and practical principles of editing using a computer-controlled and post-production system utilizing sync sound film and video material. This class is a hands-on workshop. Screenings of excerpts from feature and short films are used to demonstrate editorial concepts.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Basic Sound
courses.description: A thorough analysis of sound theory and practical applications to give students the tools to understand how sound can be successfully recorded, edited, sweetened and re-recorded (mixed) for film and video.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Acting for the Screen
courses.description: This course provides students with an understanding of the role of a film actor. Students will focus on developing comprehensive skills for acting on the screen, communicating with directors and making acting choices that enhance the film. It will also develop students’ understanding of what it is like to be an actor on screen. Students will be exposed to different acting techniques that will also help develop language between the actors and the director.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: TV Industry
courses.description: The course is designed to provide an overview of the organizational structures and business models utilized by current television content and distribution companies. In addition to looking at the basic structure of an organization, the course will also examine the often delicate, unusual and sometimes combative inter-relationship of company divisions, competitors, advertisers and audiences. We will profile the top media companies and the industry leaders/entrepreneurs that have shaped the medium thus far and into the future. Each class will begin with a discussion of current industry.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Portfolio Prep
courses.description: Students will organize and reflect on materials in preparation for their Year II portfolio crits.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Sophomore.

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Scene Analysis
courses.description: This course is intended to build upon core concepts introduced during FMTV 100: Visual Storytelling. Our focus will be on advanced analysis of scenes, inspecting how the drama is constructed through blocking, lensing, movement, and mise en scène. Our focus will include cinematic storytelling in both theatrical film and prestige television.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 100 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Audio Production and Post
courses.description: This course is an introduction to the creation and manipulation of digital audio files. It is geared towards the Digital Media student with respect to applying soundtrack elements to their images. Topics will include recording dialog, location sound recording, sound effects design, music editing, and multi-track mixing.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Intermediate Cinematography
courses.description: This course provides advanced focus in cinematic concepts and techniques and their use in filmmaking. We will study and understand the qualities of light and how it affects images, and strengthen our knowledge of lens physics. We will learn to choose the appropriate lens for any given shot. We will learn how to use a light meter and other tools to correctly expose shots. Assigned projects will provide opportunities to harness all this technical knowledge in the service of creativity.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: (FMTV 110 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 110 [Min Grade: D]) and (FMTV 115 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 115 [Min Grade: D]) and (FMTV 120 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 120 [Min Grade: D])

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Intermediate Lighting
courses.description: This course emphasizes learning to model figures and shape scenery with light for film and video production. We will cover methods of creating mood and atmosphere through light appropriate to the story of a particular film or program.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 110 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 110 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Intermediate Editing
courses.description: This course will build upon Adobe Premiere and Avid editing principles taught in FMTV 115, with increased emphasis on editing aesthetics.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: (FMTV 110 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 110 [Min Grade: D]) and (FMTV 115 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 115 [Min Grade: D]) and (FMTV 120 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 120 [Min Grade: D])

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: DIT & Workflows
courses.description: In this class students will learn the technical process of DIT (Digital Information Technology), from the pre-production phase thru delivery of the project.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 115 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 115 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Intermediate Sound
courses.description: This course is designed to build upon the audio production recording skills achieved in FMTV 120: Basic Sound. Students will learn how to operate advanced industry standard field recorders and mix sound for multiple set microphones, including wireless microphones, and will become adept at troubleshooting potential film production audio issues.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 120 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 120 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Intermediate TV Studio
courses.description: This course is an Introduction to directing live and taped multi-camera television productions in a studio setting. The emphasis will be on developing solid, basic directing technique that will be built upon in subsequent additional courses. Additionally, the basics of producing live TV programming will be discussed.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 130 [Min Grade: D] or TVPR 100 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Narrative Production
courses.description: This course is designed to build upon the skills learned in Basic Cinematography (FMTV 110), Basic Sound (FMTV 120), and Basic Editing (FMTV 115) introducing additional production and post methodologies. Increased emphasis is placed upon the ability of the student to use the resources of the medium in a professional manner.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 280 [Min Grade: D] or SCRP 281 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Microbudget Film
courses.description: This course examines alternative production models that free filmmakers to take creative risk and work outside of traditional structures. Course includes screenings, workshops, and the making of a short film.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Documentary Production
courses.description: Builds on the knowledge of cinematic language and basic production technique learned in FMTV 110. Students become familiar with documentary shooting and editing strategies and produce final documentary projects.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: (FMTV 110 [Min Grade: D] and (FMTV 115 [Min Grade: D] and (FMTV 120 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Non-Fiction Series Production
courses.description: This course gives students instruction and experience in doing non-fiction series in the field. Students will learn the fundamentals of non-fiction series storytelling, while creating a pitch package for a new show concept in groups.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 250 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Commercials and Promos
courses.description: Students analyze and produce a wide variety of commercials and promos. Fundamental concepts of brand marketing are presented and utilized in the production of student’s own script-to-screen commercials and promos. This history of commercials, both in the United States and worldwide, is also studied.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: (FMTV 110 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 110 [Min Grade: D]) and (FMTV 115 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 115 [Min Grade: D]) and (FMTV 120 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 120 [Min Grade: D])

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Basic Directing
courses.description: This course provides students with an understanding of the role of a film director. Students focus on the development of comprehensive skills for directing technical personnel, exposure to directing styles, communicating with actors and cinematic choices.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: (FMTV 110 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 110 [Min Grade: D]) and (FMTV 115 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 115 [Min Grade: D]) and (FMTV 120 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 120 [Min Grade: D])
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Intermediate Directing
courses.description: This course gives students instruction and experience in producing, interpreting, staging, directing, shooting, and live-cutting scenes in a studio. Students will experience the challenges of managing a cast and crew while simultaneously dealing with the kind of time, resource, and creative challenges that exist in the professional world.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 270 [Min Grade: D] or TVPR 200 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Basic Producing
courses.description: This course covers essential aspects of producing including script breakdowns, budgeting, scheduling, running a production, and guiding a film through post.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Producing for Television
courses.description: This course introduces students to the art and craft of producing for television and examines every aspect of the producer’s role in the developing, selling, pre-production, production, post-production, delivery, and marketing of a show. Students will also learn the functions of all other jobs involved in a production.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 280 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Research, Sales and Programming
courses.description: Research, sales and programming are the core of the TV industry. Students examine the selling environment; the research process; the meaning of "audience"; metrics; the sales process; market analysis; program pomotion; and broadcast, cable, radio, and interactive media sales. Formats, day parts, scheduling, linkages and promotions are also explored.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 280 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Legal Basics for Filmmakers
courses.description: This course is designed to provide students with knowledge of basic business and legal issues in the film industry, and to develop a working understanding of intellectual property, contracts and other issues which apply to filmmaking, to assist the student in understanding the legal issues related to creative works.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Media Law and Ethics
courses.description: This course is an introduction to the areas of the law, current legal issues and practical legal understandings relevant to the media industry as viewed through the day-to-day professional experience of the senior media executive and/or any individual working the industry.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 185 [Min Grade: D] or EAM 130 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Production Design
courses.description: This course is designed to instruct in the techniques and methods of designing a set for film and television.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Film & TV Internship
courses.description: Students work part-time for local companies to gain professional experience.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Screen Action Choreography
courses.description: In this course, a variety of different types of action scenes ranging from fistfights to car chases will be studied. Through screenings of successful action scenes and shot by shot analysis the student will learn the importance of camera placement and ample coverage. Through the combination of screenings and hands-on action arrangement the student will gain an understanding of what is involved in a successful action sequence and have to skills to execute them.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Introduction to Money and the Media
courses.description: This course focuses on the economics of various segments of the media business, with an emphasis on television through its past, present and future incarnations. Instruction will focus on the business models for various media, and case studies of financial decisions faced by media companies.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Camera Operators Workshop
courses.description: A hands-on introduction to the role of the camera operator in filmmaking.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 210 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Steadicam Workshop
courses.description: A hands-on introduction to the use of the Steadicam as a creative production tool. The course will cover basic theory, set-up, and operation of the Steadicam with various cameras.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 310 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 310 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Advanced Camera
courses.description: This is a hands-on course that instructs in the use of emerging technologies in the film industry.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 310 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 310 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Advanced Editing
courses.description: This course builds upon the intermediate skills taught in FMVD 237- Intermediate Editing. Students advance towards editing larger scale productions, address challenges to specific types of projects, and explore advanced techniques.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 215 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 237 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Cutting Trailers
courses.description: View, analyze and produce theotrical trailers and promos, as well as study the marketing methods that drive these productions. The history of trailers will also be studied.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 215 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 237 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Post Color Correction
courses.description: This course is designed to introduce students to the aesthetic and technical techniques of color grading using Blackmagic Design’s DaVinci Resolve. Color Grading requires students to grasp the concepts of video scopes, color theory, and the glossary of colorist terms.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 210 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Audio Post Production
courses.description: Sound Post-Production is a workshop that allows students to thoroughly focus on the audio portion of editing. In this course, the individual components of sound design are presented to students in order to understand how all the components work together to form a solid soundtrack.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 220 [Min Grade: D] or MIP 233 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Directing the Score
courses.description: This course will provide the filmmaker student with the communication tools to direct a film score composer.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 220 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Production Workshop
courses.description: The Workshop is designed to provide advanced students with the skills, time and manpower necessary to successfully complete a larger fictional project. It offers students the experience of working with a group of people to create a collaborative vision.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 240 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 215 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: TV Series Production I
courses.description: Students start with scripts for multiple episodes written in SCRP 353. They do all pre-production including casting, location scouting, budgeting, scheduling, and production design. They then shoot every page of script, getting all the coverage needed to produce finished episodes for DUTV.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 110 [Min Grade: D] and FMTV 115 [Min Grade: D] and FMTV 120 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: TV Series Production II
courses.description: Continued exploration of production techniques hones FMTV 345 TV Production I. Students start with scripts for multiple episodes written in SCRP 353. They do all pre-production including casting, location scouting, budgeting, scheduling, and production design. They then shoot every page of script, getting all the coverage needed to produce finished episodes for DUTV.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 110 [Min Grade: D] and FMTV 115 [Min Grade: D] and FMTV 120 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Documentary Workshop I
courses.description: This course builds on your experience in the introductory-level FMTV 250 Documentary Production course and offers an intermediate-level experience in creating a documentary. You will have 2 terms to do so – a total of six months. The first term focuses on selecting your subject and early stages of production.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 250 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Documentary Workshop II
courses.description: This course is a continuation of FMTV 350, Documentary Workshop. The second term focuses on adjusting course and strategy to evolve in reactionto the subject. Multiple edits will be completed as the story is discovered and shaped.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 250 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: DNews
courses.description: This course teaches the basics of producing and writing news segments for magazine shows on broadcast and cable, and provides opportunities to hone those skills by realizing, developing, writing and producing multiple stories for DNEWS.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Experimental Production
courses.description: This course explores experimental theses and techniques in film. Self-discovery, working through a process, and developing varied strategies are part of each student's journey that culminates in a finished experimental film.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Show Business
courses.description: Students in Los Angeles as part of the Drexel in LA program will learn about the business aspects of the entertainment industry through lectures and guest speakers drawn from the entertainment industry.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Special Effects Makeup
courses.description: Introduction to the materials and techniques used in the creation of a character or special effects make-up for film and video. Through demonstrations and hands-on projects, students learn the basics of cosmetic application and more specialized techniques.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Junior Project I
courses.description: This is a two-term course for directors to create a short junior level narrative project. Options include 5-8 page narrative films or short-form series. Students must present a one-page treatment to the instructor before admittance into the course as space is limited. The first term is focused on development, writing, and casting.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 240 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 215 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Junior Project II
courses.description: This is a two-term course for directors to create a short junior level narrative project. Options include 5-8 page narrative films or short-form series. Students must present a one-page treatment to the instructor before admittance into the course as space is limited. The second term is focused on production, post-production, and festivals.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 395 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Career Prep
courses.description: The course is a mix of lecture, guest visits, and presentation of work. All students work on a common foundation of assets that can be shared with potential employers or collaborators. Emphasis is on taking concrete steps toward post-grad careers as active filmmakers.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Senior.

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: TV Series Editing
courses.description: This course is intended to emulate as closely as possible the experience of editing a prime-time network television series.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 215 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 237 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Senior Project I
courses.description: The student plans and produces a long-term project during the senior year with faculty supervision. The project is expected to integrate the academic and practical knowledge the student has acquired in the area of film and TV. Term one is focused on pitching, development, and organization.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Senior.

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Senior Project II
courses.description: The student plans and produces a long-term project during the senior year with faculty supervision. The project is expected to integrate the academic and practical knowledge the student has acquired in the area of film and TV. The second term is primarily focused on production, as students schedule and shoot their films.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 495 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Senior Project III
courses.description: The student plans and produces a long-term project during the senior year with faculty supervision. The project is expected to integrate the academic and practical knowledge the student has acquired in the area of film and TV. The third section will focus on post-production, as students edit, color, and mix their films.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 496 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Independent Study in Film & TV
courses.description: This course permits students to independently produce a project outside of coursework.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Independent Study in Film & TV
courses.description: This course permits students to independently produce a project outside of coursework.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.title: Independent Study in Film & TV
courses.description: This course permits students to independently produce a project outside of coursework.

courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.title: Independent Study in Film & TV
courses.description: This course permits students to independently produce a project outside of coursework.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: FMTV
courses.title: Special Topics in Film & TV
courses.description: An in-depth exploration of subjects not currently covered in the required curriculum.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.description: An in-depth exploration of subjects not currently covered in the required curriculum.

FMST.name: Film Studies
FMST.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Film History I: Emergence
courses.description: This course covers the emergence and evolution of film narrative in the first half of the 20th Century, as well as the core concepts of film analysis that help us understand this process. We will focus on the artistic and institutional factors contributing to the rise and decline of Classical Hollywood Cinema.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Film History II: New Waves
courses.description: This course investigates the liberation of film aesthetics in the latter half of the 20th Century, and how filmmakers of this era redefined their medium. Particular emphasis is placed on the "new waves" of filmmaking in Western Europe and the "New Hollywood" revolution that soon followed.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMST 101 [Min Grade: D] or FMST 105 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Film History & Theory I
courses.description: This course covers the emergence and evolution of film narrative in the first half of the 20th Century, as well as the core concepts of film analysis that help us understand this process. The focus will be on the artistic and institutional factors contributing to the rise and decline of Classical Hollywood Cinema as well as the major theories regarding film form.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Film History III: Trends
courses.description: This course explores recent trends in domestic and international cinema, including the independent and multi-national filmmaking movements and ideologies that flourished around the turn of the 21st Century, as well as current developments in mainstream Hollywood cinema.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMST 102 [Min Grade: D] or FMST 205 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Film Voice and Style
courses.description: Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery; however, filmmakers also must develop their own unique voice and style. In this course students will undertake an in-depth study of a particular filmmaker, style, genre, or movement and submit a paper, film or project that will the summation of their research.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Film History & Theory II
courses.description: In this course, we will discuss the rise of Italian Neo-Realism, the French New Wave, and the so-called “Art House” film movements that contributed to the dramatic liberation of film aesthetics in the latter half of the 20th-century and to the rise of the “New Hollywood” revolution of the late sixties and seventies. We will continue looking at key works through the lens of film theory.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMST 105 [Min Grade: D] or FMST 101 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Documentary Studies
courses.description: Involves intensive study of major documentary film and video works. Covers topics including propaganda, documentary's relationship to social reality, documentary aesthetics, and the problem of "thruth" in documentary.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Films of Gus Van Sant
courses.description: In this course the work of Gus Van Sant, starting with his feature debut in 1986 through MILK in 2008, will be examined. Class will include some lecture, but largely be discussion-driven; students are required to do additional reading and reflection papers each week.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: The Western
courses.description: Explores the genre of the classic American Western. Students analyze a selection of Westerns to acquire an understanding of the human and cimematic values they embody.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Film Comedy
courses.description: Examines a broad selection of film comedies in search of principles that underlie successful film comedy.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: The Cinematographer's Art
courses.description: This course examines the craft and style of some of the greatest feature film cinematographers.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Social Advocacy in Cinema
courses.description: This course will examine the use of film as a vehicle for social advocacy. The films screened will span decades, genres, and subject matter, and the methods of persuasion will range from the symbolic to the literal, but each film will offer significant social commentary relevant to the era in which they were made.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Hollywoodland I
courses.description: This course examines the history, culture and mythology of Hollywood through ten films, ranging from the silent era to the present, which the entertainment industry has made about itself. Topics to be covered include the growth of Los Angeles as a city, perceptions of stars and producers, the coming of sound in 1927 and the intersection of entertainment and politics. Films to be shown include "A Star is Born," "Sunset Boulevard," "The Front," "A Face in the Crowd," and other lesser-known works. Readings: "What Makes Sammy Run?," "The Last Tycoon," "The Day of the Locust," and "Once in a Lifetime.".
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Hollywoodland II
courses.description: This course continues to examine the history, culture and mythology of Hollywood through films the entertainment industry has made about itself. In this course, the films looked at are primarily from the 1980s on, including "The Stunt Man," "My Favorite Year," "The Comedian" and "The Artist." Also discussed: the effect of television on the film industry, the breakup of the studio system in the late 40’s-early 50’s, the rise of programming created for HBO and other pay cable outlets, and changing perceptions of the business itself.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMST 290 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Japanese Cinema: Kurosawa
courses.description: This course will be a survey of some of the major films of Akira Kurosawa, who is widely heralded as one of the greatest filmmakers of the 20th century. His films will be looked at in the context of both Japanese cinema, especially the cinema that preceded him, and world cinema in general.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Film Voice and Style
courses.description: Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery; however, filmmakers also must develop their own unique voice and style. In this course students will undertake an in-depth study of a particular filmmaker, style, genre, or movement and submit a paper, film or project that will the summation of their research.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: The Horror Film
courses.description: This course reviews the history of the horror film and its various sub-genres and analyzes the methods employed in the most successful films. Students dissect the representation of evil and the impact these films have on culture.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Contemporary Cinema
courses.description: Students interpret and assess contemporary film in light of film history and aesthetics. Includes viewing and analysis of a different current film each week.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Independent Study in Film Studies
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: FMST
courses.title: Independent Study in Film Studies
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

GMAP.name: Game Art and Production
GMAP.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Game Design Lab I
courses.description: This course will cover an overview of fundamental image creation and editing tools, like Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator, in the framework of creative experimentation with analog game design exercises using a combination of digital and physical fabrication skills.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Game Design Lab II
courses.description: This course will cover an overview of the fundamental design skills of digital games using a variety of game engines, including interactive text, 2d and 3d game engines, and grey-boxing with primitive shapes in-engine and modeling tools, exploiting the systems and existing asset libraries available for rapid experimentation.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Overview of Game Playtesting
courses.description: This course introduces various topics under the labels of user research (UR), user experience (UX), usability testing, and quality assurance (QA) software testing, and related fields, as they apply to game development. Students will become familiar with general approaches and techniques through in-class lectures and participation in practical testing of active game projects by student teams in other courses.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Basic Portfolio
courses.description: This course focuses on the basics of portfolio creation, editing, and presentation while examining portfolio examples of current professionals in a variety of game development roles that can serve as models for student portfolio development.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Game User Interface Design
courses.description: This course covers the design, prototyping, and evaluation of graphical user interfaces for digital games by exploring topics such as human capabilities, input technologies, heuristic evaluation, and design methods, principles and rules. Students will learn how to design aesthetically pleasing and effective game user interfaces, covering important design principles (learnability, visibility, error prevention, efficiency, and visual design) and the human capabilities that motivate them (including perception, motor skills, color vision, attention, and human error).
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Concept Art for Games
courses.description: This course introduces students to the process of designing and creating concept art for games as part of the overall development pipeline. Using a variety of techniques including sketching, photo and kit-bashing, and overpainting, students will learn to ideate and communicate concepts and prepare materials for subsequent stages of asset production.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Scripting for Game Design
courses.description: This course explores modern game engine scripting languages that are event-driven, control the art assets, provide multiplayer communication, and database access.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: CS 140 [Min Grade: D] or CS 150 [Min Grade: D] or CS 171 [Min Grade: D] or DIGM 131 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Advanced Portfolio
courses.description: This course focuses on building skills for the career-long practice of producing and maintaining a professional creative portfolio while allowing the students the opportunity to create or refine additional student-driven portfolio work that synthesizes their skills and experience from direct class assignments in their other coursework.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 4 times for 5 credits
courses.prerequisites: GMAP 123 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Overview of Computer Gaming
courses.description: This course presents an overview of computer gaming, including its history, its foundation in traditional games and its contemporary forms. The relationship among genres, platforms and audiences are examined and critical evaluation skills are developed.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Game History
courses.description: This course explores the history of video games from their analog roots and examines the video game industry from the earliest arcade entertainments to modern digital distribution networks. It will investigate the people who made technical, design, and business decisions that have had lasting, industry-wide effects that are still with us today.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Advanced Game Playtesting
courses.description: In this course students will play the role of a game user researcher (GUR) and learn how to conduct more advanced and rigorous playtests and how to run professional-quality studies that support a better understanding of player behavior and identify usability issues. Students will develop and run a study using an existing game project.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: GMAP 121 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Entrepreneurial Game Studio Incubator Lab Project
courses.description: In this course, students who are active members of a team in Drexel’s Entrepreneurial Game Studio, produce a professional-level, team-based, interactive project in a real-world production environment. It requires a project that demonstrates the integration of the student's academic and practical knowledge of the field as well as one or more specializations. Students refine their understanding of execution, delivery, and presentation of quality digital media production through implementation of professional best practices, and perfect their written, oral, and visual presentation skills through the power of collaboration, teamwork, and shared missions.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Serious Games
courses.description: This course explores development of games for education. Goals include understanding and appreciating the psychology of play and the principles of game design in developing educational games.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: GMAP 377 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Experimental Games
courses.description: This course explores new ideas and innovative gameplay through constraints of team size and shortened development cycles.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: GMAP 377 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Game Development Foundations
courses.description: This course introduces students to the computer game design process. Students also learn how the individual skills of modeling, animation, scripting, interface design and storytelling are coordinated to produce interactive media experiences.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: (ANIM 141 [Min Grade: D] or ANIM 145 [Min Grade: D] or CS 265 [Min Grade: D]) and GMAP 260 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Game Design from the Player’s Perspective
courses.description: This course is an introduction to game design from a player's perspective. Students will experience a variety of games and analyze them with respect to the use of game design principles and their consequences for game play.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Architecture & Game Level Design Workshop
courses.description: This course is an interdisciplinary look at the overlap between architecture and game-level design. Students will engage with the construction of interactive spaces in both the physical and game worlds using form, space, and color to design virtual environments to guide players, tell stories, facilitate actions, and evoke emotions. The course will reinforce important architectural design concepts in the realm of game-level design and introduce new analysis techniques for wayfinding and visibility. Game design tools will also be introduced to architecture students or reinforced to game design students. The course assignments will be individual, and the final project will be group-based which expects students to synthesize their understanding of architectural and level design concepts and skills.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: GMAP 102 [Min Grade: D] or ARCH 134 [Min Grade: D] or ARCH 224 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Character Animation for Gaming
courses.description: This course focuses on character animation techniques for real-time graphics, including cyclical animations, procedural animation, motion capture and integration into game engines.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: GMAP 231 [Min Grade: D] (Can be taken Concurrently) and ANIM 211 [Min Grade: D] and (GMAP 345 [Min Grade: D] or CS 345 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Artificial Intelligence in Gaming
courses.description: This course teaches the use and integration of state machines into game engines, as well as other methods for creating and controlling Non Player Characters (NPCs).
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: (GMAP 345 [Min Grade: D] or CS 345 [Min Grade: D]) and (CS 172 [Min Grade: D] or GMAP 231 [Min Grade: D])

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Mobile Game Development
courses.description: This course explores development of games for mobile platforms. Specifically addressed will be platform issues such as processor speed, screen resolution, user interface and memory.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: GMAP 345 [Min Grade: D] or CS 345 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Game Development: Workshop I
courses.description: This course examines the roles of the executive producer and the development team in taking a computer game from concept to design document through production. Students will work in small teams to research andplan a production effort that results in a pre-production prototype.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: GMAP 345 [Min Grade: D] or CS 345 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Game Development: Workshop II
courses.description: This course provides an environment in which the pre-production of GMAP 377 Game Development: Workshop I can be taken through a full production effort. Students work in small teams to bring a selected prototype to completion.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: GMAP 377 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Advanced Game Design and Production
courses.description: This course will step through the various modules of game engines, enabling students to gain access to real-time shaders and materials, particle systems and animation techniques.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: GMAP 345 [Min Grade: D] or CS 345 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Audio for Games
courses.description: This course is an advanced introduction into the use of industry standard middleware tools and game engine for designing game audio.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: GMAP 231 [Min Grade: D] or GMAP 345 [Min Grade: D] or CS 345 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: GMAP
courses.title: Independent Study in Game Art and Production
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

VSCM.name: Graphic Design
VSCM.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Computer Imaging I
courses.description: This course explores current potentials, limitations, and issues related to use of computer software for design applications. Projects include graphics creation and manipulation; image acquisition, creation and manipulation; text creation and manipulation; typography; input and output options and control; hardware/software/system fundamentals; and troubleshooting.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Calligraphy
courses.description: Covers the skills and understanding of letterforms as geometry and type, development of hand/eye skill in letter-forming, investigation of solids and voids, and use of traditional and modern tools and materials. Studio.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSST 110 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Computer Imaging II
courses.description: Provides continued study of electronic imaging with emphasis on Graphic Design process for print and screen design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 100 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Web Graphics I
courses.description: This course focuses on the concepts, issues and techniques related to the design of Websites. Emphasis is on the design and hierarchy of a website. Students will utilize HTML, XHTML, basic JavaScript, dynamic HTML, and Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) skills.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Web Graphics II
courses.description: Continues VSCM 220. Increases the complexity and scope of the art direction and design for web graphics. Students will focus on professional quality web pages using dedicated software that adheres to current industry standards.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 220 [Min Grade: D] or WMGD 220 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Web Graphics III
courses.description: Continues VSCM 221 and increases the complexity and scope of the art direction and design for web graphics. Students will focus on professional quality web pages using dedicated software that adheres to current industry standards.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: (VSCM 221 [Min Grade: D] or WMGD 330 [Min Grade: D]) and VSCM 231 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Visual Communication I
courses.description: Provides an overview of graphic design as an applied art. Covers the given, the formal, and the psychological aspects of graphic design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSST 102 [Min Grade: D] or VSST 105 [Min Grade: D] or VSST 100 [Min Grade: D] or VSST 107 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Visual Communication II
courses.description: Continues VSCM 230. Covers corporate identity and explores logo development using the pictoral mark, typographic solution, and abstract interpretation as symbols of identity.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 230 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Visual Communication III
courses.description: Examines problems in graphic design on the relationship between designer and client, including solving specific situations of image-making with emphasis on the total identity of an organization, firm, or publication. Involves extensive exploration of color and imagery. Studio.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 231 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Typography I
courses.description: Uses the history of type as the backdrop for the introduction to the art and craft of conventional through state-of-the-art typesetting as well as the creative and extraordinary use of type. Focuses on the letter, word, and sentence. Studio/lecture.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSST 102 [Min Grade: D] or VSST 105 [Min Grade: D] or VSST 107 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Production
courses.description: Covers traditional and electronic means of print production. Explores alternate means of production and various printing and output methods. Studio.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 240 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Typography II
courses.description: Continues VSCM 240. Broadens the scope to deal with the paragraph and the typeset page, with increased attention to the importance of subtleties and refinements. Explores the differing requirements of type in relationship to pictorial images.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 240 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: On Screen Typography
courses.description: This course develops a visual sensitivity to typographical compositions on screen while expanding knowledge of current technologies.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is DIGM or major is GRDS.

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Motion Graphics I
courses.description: This course focuses on the concepts, issues and techniques related to the design of Websites. Emphasis is on the design and hierarchy of a website. Students will utilize HTML, XHTML, basic JavaScript, dynamic HTML, and Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) skills.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 221 [Min Grade: D] or WMGD 330 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Visual Communication IV
courses.description: This course focuses on techniques and methods of advanced problem solving and exploration of extended identity systems. Students learn to analyze conceptual and contextual relationships pertinent to any visual communication assignment.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 232 [Min Grade: D] and VSCM 222 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Visual Communication V
courses.description: This course focuses on information graphics, including signage, environmental graphic design, and exhibit design. Information graphics are graphic visual representations of information, data or knowledge. These graphics present complex information quickly and clearly. Studio.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 332 [Min Grade: D] or VSCM 331 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Typography III
courses.description: Typography III concentrates on the exploration and management of large blocks of text in specific design problems. Special emphasis will be placed on the style and readability of typographic treatments.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 242 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: IKI: Tamagawa-Drexel Exchange
courses.description: The 12-day program is open to all University students and entails a collaboration between Drexel students and Tamagawa students in Japan as well as at Drexel (Philadelphia). In Japan, students will survey and experience the true Japan by visiting exceptional sites that exemplify the old and the new world of Japanese culture and life. The trip will balance visits between the everyday/industries and cultural sites/museums to capture a comprehensive understanding of the Japanese “IKI.” In Philadelphia, each group (made of Tamagawa and Drexel students) will conduct on-site research in historical and cultural venues and neighborhoods. Students will learn about immigration history, changing cultures over generations, and the challenges that diverse communities face.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Graphic Design: 20th Century and Beyond
courses.description: Concentrates on impact and significance of the graphic design profession in society through the history and movements of the profession and the work of 20th-century masters of visual communication. Students will analyze conceptual and contextual relationships and develop greater awareness of stylistic content and its relevance to the culture.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Design on Site
courses.description: Weekly visits to studios of various design disciplines such as small graphic design offices, environmental graphic design firms, advertising agencies, book and magazine publishers, and website developers. A written report is due at the end of the term.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 232 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is GRDS.

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Experimental Publication Design
courses.description: This course concentrates on exploring alternative formats and unique delivery systems for the transfer of information. Special emphasis is placed on developing appropriate imagery for the defined readership, formatting, the use of a comprehensive grid system and the development of a wayfinding system for the publication. The course will build a greater awareness of proportion, readability and information transfer, and will reinforce the use of color as a visual communication tool.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 232 [Min Grade: D] and VSCM 242 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Visual Communication VI
courses.description: Continues VSCM 333. Explores three-dimensional graphic design processes and techniques for communication, including problems of scale, material, form, and function. Emphasizes package design. Includes point-of-purchase design. Studio.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 322 [Min Grade: D] and VSCM 333 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Book Design
courses.description: Investigates design of books, from their pre-Gutenberg origins to contemporary technology of design, binding, paper, and finishing. Includes multiple page formats, production grids, and sequential images. Lecture/studio.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 322 [Min Grade: D] and VSCM 333 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Professional Portfolio
courses.description: Focuses on the preparation of a professional Graphic Design portfolio. A critical process that includes the screening of completed projects, reworking or expanding projects, and reconstructing/creating final portfolio components. A formal interview presentation of the portfolio is also explored and refined.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 430 [Min Grade: D] or ADGD 320 [Min Grade: D] or EVGD 320 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is GRDS.

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Professional Practice
courses.description: Covers running a design office, including basic contracts, fee structures, and the design process. Explores types of design offices; working with suppliers, printers, photographers, and illustrators; scheduling; resumes and portfolios; taxes; and marketing of graphic design services. Lecture/field work.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 430 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Graphic Design Seminar: Advanced Techniques
courses.description: An exploration for the subtleties that distinguish excellence in graphic design print, web and motion venues. Selections include: Advanced Typography and Electronic Portfolio.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 9 credits
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 340 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Graphic Design Seminar: Advanced Media
courses.description: An exploration of advanced media development in Graphic Design as relevancy and currency demands. Selections include: Illustration I and II and Bookmaking.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 12 credits
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 232 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is GRDS.

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Annual Report Design
courses.description: Development and analysis of the corporate annual report as a graphic design concept and as a developed marketing tool.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 340 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Senior Capstone
courses.description: Requires each student to define a problem and set a goal and strategies, develop a concept, and carry out a solution. Divides time among research, design, thematic development, and final presentation. Requires instructor approval of study.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSCM 221 [Min Grade: D] and VSCM 322 [Min Grade: D] and VSCM 430 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Independent Study in Graphic Design
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Independent Study in Graphic Design
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Independent Study in Graphic Design
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Independent Study in Graphic Design
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Special Topics in Graphic Design
courses.description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

courses.title: Special Topics in Graphic Design
courses.description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

courses.subject: VSCM
courses.title: Special Topics in Graphic Design
courses.description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
