courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

IDM.name: Interactive Digital Media
IDM.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Introduction to Web Development
courses.description: This is an entry level course for non-interactive digital media majors that introduces students to the process of managing online content as well as how to define the presentation styles and interaction modes for the user through the use of a content management system.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: History of Web Development
courses.description: This course explores all aspects of web development including the foundations of web technologies, formulation of web standards and how the individual web surfer's wants and needs have changed over time. Also discussed will be ground-breaking websites and the evolution of interface design for the web.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: User Interface Design I
courses.description: This course covers the design, prototyping, and evaluation of graphical user interfaces by exploring topics like human capabilities, input technologies, heuristic evaluation, and design methods, principles and rules. We will learn how to design aesthetically pleasing user interfaces, covering important design principles (learnability, visibility, error prevention, efficiency, and visual design) and the human capabilities that motivate them (including perception, motor skills, color vision, attention, and human error).
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: User Interface Design II
courses.description: This course builds upon the topics covered in User Interface Design I by exploring advanced topics of graphical user interface design for desktop, mobile, and touch screen devices.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 211 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Interaction Design
courses.description: This course is a study of interaction design. You will explore principles, patterns and process for interaction design, define the structure and behavior of interactive systems and how these can be used to create meaningful relationships between people and the products and services that they use.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 212 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Human Factors Engineering
courses.description: Discusses ways of applying psychological and physiological principles to the design of interactive systems, products, processes, and systems to address human capabilities and limitations in ways that ensure safety, effectiveness, and ease of use.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: User Experience Design I
courses.description: In this course, students learn to identify and implement the elements required to create incredible digital experiences. Through the application of user-centered design practices, students will develop predictive and enjoyable designs based on a holistic consideration of users’ experience. Topics covered in this course include brand personality, research strategies, content strategy, information architecture, and usability.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 213 [Min Grade: D] (Can be taken Concurrently)

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: User Experience Design II
courses.description: This course focuses on taking prototypes from User Design I and creating fully functioning web apps. Students will create and execute a full production pipeline and learn to incorporate User Design practices along the way.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 215 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Web Design I
courses.description: This course is a comprehensive overview of the design, creation, delivery and maintenance of functional, standards-based content on the Internet. Students will learn the aesthetics of web design alongside the underlying markup languages. They will critically evaluate web design quality, learn how to create and maintain quality web sites, and learn about accessibility and web design standards, and why they are important.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 211 [Min Grade: D] (Can be taken Concurrently)

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Web Design II
courses.description: This course builds upon the topics covered in Web Authoring I by exploring advanced web development topics and current industry best practices.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 221 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Scripting for Interactive Digital Media I
courses.description: This course explores modern client-side scripting languages that interact with the user, control the browser, communicate asynchronously, and alter document content and functionality.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 221 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Scripting for Interactive Digital Media II
courses.description: This course explores modern server-side technologies for Internet based delivery of dynamic content that connect to and manipulate database content. Students learn how to build interactive, data-driven products.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 231 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Interactive Graphics
courses.description: In this course, students learn how to use modern development techniques to create responsive and scalable two-dimensional graphics with support for interactivity and dynamic animation. Topics include styling and transforming vector graphics, raster graphics, and text where the implementation takes future growth into consideration.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 222 [Min Grade: D] and (IDM 231 [Min Grade: D] or INFO 151 [Min Grade: D])

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Microinteractions
courses.description: In this course, students learn to identify and implement the elements required to create incredible digital experiences. Through the application of user-experience design practices, students will develop predictive and enjoyable interactive designs based on a holistic consideration of users’ experience. Topics covered in this course include brand personality, content strategy, information architecture, and usability.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 213 [Min Grade: D] (Can be taken Concurrently) and IDM 231 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Web Game Design
courses.description: Examines multimedia-authoring tools used to create interactive games. Students learn real world production techniques as they master advanced game design concepts.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 231 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Content Management Systems
courses.description: Students set up a content management system and develop a custom theme. Includes project planning, organizing and maintaining a quality code base.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 222 [Min Grade: D] and (IDM 232 [Min Grade: D] or INFO 152 [Min Grade: D])

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: User Interface Design for Immersive Media
courses.description: This course explores the nature of user interface design when applied to immersive media hardware, including Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality headsets.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 213 [Min Grade: D] and IDM 231 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: WebVR
courses.description: This course explores ways to deliver virtual reality experiences via a web browser.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 231 [Min Grade: D] and IDM 311 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Interactive App Design I
courses.description: Focuses on creating user experiences optimized for mobile devices. Students learn to build unique web applications that take advantage modern mobile capabilities. Special consideration is given to limited screen real estate, low bandwidth Internet access, no Internet access, and touch screen devices.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: (IDM 213 [Min Grade: D] or IDM 215 [Min Grade: D]) and IDM 231 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Interactive App Design II
courses.description: This course builds upon the topics covered in Mobile Interactive Design I by exploring how to convert web-based applications into cross-platform native applications for mobile devices. Special consideration is given to incorporating functionality that is currently unavailable in web-based applications.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 231 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Interactive App Design III
courses.description: This course explores ways to deliver and test native mobile application prototypes using IDE’s (integrated Development Environments).
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 231 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Interactive App Design IV
courses.description: Learn how to build and test dynamic web application prototypes using event driven JavaScript languages.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 231 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Interactive Digital Media Workshop I
courses.description: This course explores the developing or redesigning a successful interactive digital experience. Students work in team environments to analyze project requirements, develop a strategy for development, and utilize their design skills to present their findings to the client.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 216 [Min Grade: D] and IDM 232 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Interactive Digital Media Workshop II
courses.description: This course builds upon the topics covered in Interactive Digital Media Workshop II by continuing to work in a team environment to building a high-fidelity interactive digital media prototype with a focus on usability testing.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 371 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Experimental Interactive Technologies
courses.description: This course focuses on researching new innovations in experimental digital media technologies.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 213 [Min Grade: D] and IDM 232 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Internet of Things
courses.description: This course uses an open approach to enable quick and seamless interactions with physical objects and locations via web protocols.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: WEST 107 [Min Grade: D] and IDM 232 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Professional Practices in Interactive Digital Media
courses.description: This course will provide a broad overview of the practices of all areas included in the fields related to interactive digital media, including: organizational structure and roles, client communication and creative process, needs assessment, brief writing, brainstorming, concept development, pitches, pricing, proposals and presentations.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 372 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Validating Product Ideas
courses.description: This course will teach you how to design, implement, and measure multichannel experiences with greater impact for customers, businesses, and society.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 215 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: User Research Methodologies
courses.description: Understanding the user is the fundamental backbone of User Experience Design. This course will teach students how to construct, implement and analyze user interviews in a way that will allow them to gain deep insights into their target audience.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: IDM 215 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Storytelling for User Experience Design
courses.description: Students will learn how to use stories to understand the user, his/her goals and objectives, explain research, and describe design concepts.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Independent Study in Interactive Digital Media
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Special Topics in Interactive Digital Media
courses.description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: IDM
courses.title: Special Topics in Interactive Digital Media
courses.description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

INTR.name: Interior Design
INTR.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Visualization I: Computer Imaging
courses.description: An introductory course that explores the use of proprietary computer applications for communications and the preparation of visual materials in Interior Design. The course introduces and reinforces classic design principles for expert visual communication of ideas through digital techniques from an Interior Design perspective.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: History of Modern Architecture and Interiors
courses.description: Covers development of modern architecture and interiors in the 19th and 20th centuries. Develops a vocabulary for discussing architecture; an understanding of how various factors affect design; and a familiarity with names, movements, and buildings that are part of historical development.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Textiles for Interiors
courses.description: This course is a comprehensive introduction to textiles and their use in the interior design profession.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Visualization II: Orthographic
courses.description: This course explores design communication skills through hand drawing and model building exercises. Orthographic drawing skills are developed through investigation of plan, section, elevation and three dimensional drawings.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Environmental Design Theory
courses.description: This course introduces design students to the relationship between people and the build environment. Understanding how people perceive, interact with, and are affected by their surroundings through readings and design exercieses make evident the significance of the psychological, pyshicological, social and cultural concepts of environmental behavior as an integral part of the designed environment.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Structure
courses.description: Investigates structure as an organizing principle in design by man and nature. Explores the basic objective and subjective relationships between form and function. Includes professionally juried presentations.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSST 103 [Min Grade: C-] or VSST 106 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Visualization III: Digital
courses.description: An intensive introduction to two and three dimensional drawing and visualization through the computer. This course explores orthographic and perspective drawing conventions and techniques from a digital perspective.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 232 [Min Grade: C-] or INTR 322 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Visualization IV: 3D Modeling
courses.description: An intensive introduction to advanced modeling and rendering software. Students will explore lighting, materiality, advanced form and spatial experience through realistic three-dimensional digital models.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 241 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Interior Materials
courses.description: Introduces basic construction materials and how they may be used successfully by the interior designer. Includes sample materials, visual aids, and guest speakers.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Visual Culture: Interiors
courses.description: Visual Culture: Interiors addresses the interior environment by studying the role history, economics, culture, materials and technological developments, impact decisions made by designers on interior spaces. While comparing historical context with specific knowledge, this course will enable the student to be a more articulate designer by a comprehensive examination of the interiors.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Visual Culture: Furniture
courses.description: An overview of furniture in relationship to interiors, and its influences reaching from the roots of antiquity to the impact of technology in today's products. It is the study of artifacts from various time periods and cultures in relation to social and political developments, life and work styles, visual arts, and economic influences.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Sustainability: History, Theory and Critic
courses.description: Course examines the meaning and implications of sustainable design to develop an informed interpretation and working assessment of this movement. Concepts and methodologies are explored through assigned readings, class discussion, feild trips and team research.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Interior Studio I
courses.description: Foundation spatial course: Involves conscious recognition of the manipulation of space or spaces within a given volume and with a small-scale environmental orientation. Includes professionally juried presentations.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSST 103 [Min Grade: C-] or VSST 106 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Interior Studio II
courses.description: Primary spatial course. Involves conscious recognition of the manipulation of space or spaces within a given volume and small-scale environmental orientation. Includes professionally juried presentations.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 232 [Min Grade: C-] or INTR 322 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Residential Design Studio
courses.description: Provides experience with extensive real space. Emphasizes recognizing its aesthetic quality and maximizing its potential to meet the requirements of the inhabitants, by stylistic quality and elaboration in the selection and application of furniture finishes and accessories. Includes professionally juried presentations.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 233 [Min Grade: C-] or INTR 323 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Community Studio
courses.description: Covers research, diagramming, site considerations, and program requirements for a specific user group; designing for complex spatial requirements with integration of interior components and furniture. Includes professionally juried presentations.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 331 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Visualization V: Methods
courses.description: An advanced course in visualization for Interior Design. Hybrid representation strategies and specialized topics in digital and hand rendering will be covered.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 241 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Hospitality Design Studio
courses.description: This course covers the design of commercial hospitality interiors. The studio project addresses program research and diagramming, site specificity, and designing for complex requirements with an awareness of vertical circulation, light, view, and enclosure. This course requires students to develop the ceiling plane and to create a visual identity for the design of restaurant interiors. This studio includes professionally juried presentations.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 323 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Interior Detailing
courses.description: Covers basic considerations of interior construction and detailing and their application.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 250 [Min Grade: D] and (INTR 233 [Min Grade: C-] or INTR 323 [Min Grade: C-])

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Interior Lighting
courses.description: This course analyzes human needs and the perceptual responses of both general and special populations. It introduces the lighting design theory and principles and explores methods of creating mood and atmosphere with light. It develops vocabulary, documentation methods and understanding of energy conservation, lighting standards, and safety.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 350 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Collaborative Research in Sustainability
courses.description: This cumulative course is the advanced students' opportunity to participate in a collaborative, interdisciplinary team in which the students will be applying sustainable technical and conceptual education in the context of 3rd party competitions, internally defined design challenges or applied research.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ARCH 320 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman or Sophomore

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Commercial Design Studio
courses.description: Covers design of institutional-commercial interiors, including space planning, selection of materials and furnishings toward a synthesized environment, and development of specifications. Includes professionally juried presentations.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 342 [Min Grade: C-] or INTR 442 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Health & Wellness ID Studio
courses.description: This studio addresses program and design requirements for a specific demographic community. It will prepare students to tackle the complex design problems that face the growing healthcare industry. The course focuses on an interdisciplinary approach to complex problems in the interior environment for the practice areas of health, healing, and well-being. Precedent studies, programming briefs, literature reviews, and collaborative teamwork are used to create evidence-based design solutions that incorporate creativity, human factors data, user-centered design approach, life-safety codes, and building codes. This studio includes professionally juried presentations.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 430 [Min Grade: C-]

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Furniture Design
courses.description: Covers design of environmental elements, simultaneous concerns with craftsmanship and the application of materials to ideas, and development of prototypes. A lab fee is required for this course.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 13 credits
courses.prerequisites: VSST 203 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Contract Documentation for Interior Design
courses.description: Provides an understanding of the basic procedures and techniques for the development of construction drawings and furniture documentation. Requires students to use case studies to produce a set of drawings representative of current interior design industry standards.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 245 [Min Grade: D] and INTR 430 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Professional Practice
courses.description: Surveys contemporary business methods, practices, and procedures in the operation of a design firm, including legal and ethical implications. Examines these practices through case studies and lectures by design professionals.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 331 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Interior Systems
courses.description: Introduces building systems, mechanical, electrical, ceiling and furniture systems, and their effect on the interior environment. Includes visual aids and guest speakers.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 350 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Competition Studio
courses.description: Competition opportunities from regional to international from professional to philanthropic allow for investigations of diverse contemporary issues surrounding the built environment. Students work under direction of a faculty member(s) to discuss, explore and develop solutions for entry into noteworthy competitions.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Senior Project I
courses.description: Part one of the 3-term senior project where students develop a capstone independent design project from concept, research and programming to complete design development.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 430 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is INTR.

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Senior Project II
courses.description: Part two of the 3-term senior project where students develop a capstone independent design project from concept, research and programming to complete design development.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 491 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is INTR.

courses.subject: INTR
courses.title: Senior Project III
courses.description: Part three of the 3-term senior project where students develop a capstone independent design project from concept, research and programming to complete design development.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: INTR 492 [Min Grade: C-]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is INTR.

MUSC.name: Music
MUSC.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: University Chorus
courses.description: A large chorus that studies and performs music of many styles; performs each term. May be repeated for credit.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chamber Singers
courses.description: A select choir that performs advanced choral repertoire; performs frequently on and off campus. May be repeated for credit.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Naturally Sharp (Vocal Jazz Ensemble)
courses.description: Naturally Sharp is a select group of singers, chosen by audition in the fall from the University Chorus. Naturally Sharp performs vocal jazz repertoire from the past hundred years with a three-piece backup band. Singers must also be able to do solos.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: All-College Choir
courses.description: All-College Choir is a non-auditioned, mixed voice ensemble that performs repertoire of various styles, genres and eras - including music of the classical tradition, jazz, spirituals, American musical theater, folk and pop.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Concert Band
courses.description: Performs a wide variety of music written for a large band; concerts given each term. May be repeated for credit.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Guitar Ensembles
courses.description: Performs a wide variety of music written for a small guitar ensemble; concerts given at least twice a year. May be repeated for credit.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Jazz Ensembles
courses.description: Offers rehearsal, study, and performance of jazz compositions for both large and small ensembles; concerts given on and off campus, sometimes with guest soloists. May be repeated for credit.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Jazztet
courses.description: Jazztet is a subset of the larger Jazz Orchestra. Its size can vary based upon the availability of instrumentation and the desire of the director. Its purpose is to present jazz music in a small instrumentation format. Performances are typically part of the greater Jazz Orchestra concerts at the end of each term.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: University Orchestra
courses.description: This is a full orchestra that performs concert repertoire of various periods from the 18th century to the present day. Wind, brass, and percussionists must be in the concert band in order to participate.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Keyboard Ensembles
courses.description: Performs a wide variety of music written for a small keyboard ensemble; concerts given at least twice a year. May be repeated for credit.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chamber Music Ensemble
courses.description: Various small ensembles performing a variety of music of many periods and styles. May be repeated for credit.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Fusion Band
courses.description: Performs a wide variety of music written for a small fusion ensemble. The Fusion Band gives concerts at least twice a year. May be repeated for credit.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Percussion Ensembles
courses.description: Performs a wide variety of music written for a small percussion ensemble. The ensemble gives concerts at least twice a year. May be repeated for credit.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Mediterranean Ensemble
courses.description: The Drexel University Mediterranean Ensemble is open to any student with an interest in performing traditional music from the Balkans, the Middle East and Northern Africa. All instruments are welcomed.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Gospel Choir
courses.description: Performs gospel music drawn from both traditional and contemporary sources. Performance opportunities for both singers and instrumentalists. Concerts given on and off campus each term. May be repeated for credit.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Pep Band
courses.description: Pep Band is a group of roughly forty-five student musicians primarily from the concert band. The purpose of the Pep Band is to support the Drexel Dragons basketball team and play from the bleachers at home games as well as travel to tournaments.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Rock Ensemble
courses.description: Rock Ensemble is an ensemble where students have the opportunity to gain experience working as a group rehearsing, arranging, organizing, recording, and ultimately performing songs in the rock/pop/contemporary genres. By choosing music that is both of high quality and varied, students have a unique opportunity to develop a strong work ethic while being exposed to various musical challenges.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Chamber Music: Strings
courses.description: MUSC 118 forms its participants into various sized string groups from trios and quartets to octets. The repertoire spans music of the classical tradition and beyond, from the modern day back to the 17th century. These small groups will perform as part of a larger chamber recital at the end of each term.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music Fundamentals
courses.description: Music Fundamentals teaches students essential skills and knowledge relating to Western music. Focus is placed on ear training and core music theory concepts. This course perfectly compliments any student’s musical playing ability, beginning to advanced, and is essential to further musical development.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music Theory I
courses.description: MUSC 121 covers the foundations of: notation, major/minor scales and keys, intervals, chord construction, phrase construction, small forms, and basic techniques of harmonizing a melody. The methodology centers on analysis combined with application.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music Theory II
courses.description: MUSC 122 covers: texture and textural reduction, chromatic harmony, modulation, and large forms. This is a continuation of MUSC 121 and provides more depth into the topics of that course as well as offers advanced material. The methodology combines musical analysis with application.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MUSC 121 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Jazz Theory
courses.description: Jazz Theory introduces musical concepts and skills as they pertain to this specific style of music. The material discussed is foundational knowledge for jazz composition, arranging, and improvisation. Therefore, this course is suitable for students interested in jazz performance or composition.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MUSC 121 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Ear Training I
courses.description: Introduces the basics of ear training and sight singing.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MUSC 121 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Ear Training II
courses.description: Continues MUSC 125.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MUSC 125 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Introduction to Music
courses.description: Provides an introduction to music, including elements of melody, harmony, rhythm, texture, structure, history, and an introduction to various genres. Emphasizes listening with understanding.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Mambo, Samba, Salsa, and More
courses.description: This course introduces the various Latin American musical traditions, as well as their historical contexts, evolution, inter-connectivity and current importance.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Survey of Songwriting
courses.description: This course will examine the art and craft of songwriting. Students will listen to and analyze many examples from folk and popular music, from the 1930’s through to the present day. Students will use this knowledge, as well as that of basic music fundamentals, to compose a song at the end of the term.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Class Piano I
courses.description: Uses a group situation to teach basic performance skills and beginning instruction on piano.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Class Guitar I
courses.description: Uses a group situation to teach basic performance skills and beginning instruction on guitar.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Class Percussion I
courses.description: Uses a group situation to teach basic performance skills and beginning instruction on percussion.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Class Voice I
courses.description: Uses a group situation to teach basic performance skills and beginning instruction in voice.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Class Bass I
courses.description: Class Bass I uses group instruction to teach basic performance skills and techniques on electric bass guitar and upright bass.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 6 credits

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Class Bass II
courses.description: Class Bass II uses group instruction to teach advanced performance skills and techniques on electric bass guitar and upright bass.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 6 credits

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Jazz Class Piano
courses.description: Students will learn the fundamentals in jazz piano playing by studying the melodic, harmonic and rhythmic aspects associated with jazz. Students will learn how to read, “lead sheets” and improvise over modal and standard chord changes.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Modern Arranging Techniques
courses.description: Modern Arranging Techniques. Discusses the capabilities and ranges of varying instruments. Students study modern arranging techniques utilizing strategies and standard music material.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MUSC 122 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: European Classical Music History
courses.description: This course surveys and analyzes compositions from antiquity through the modern period in European music history. After an overview of musical vocabulary, we will study selected masterpieces of Western music, thereby gaining a greater appreciation for developments of musical style.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: European Classical Music History II
courses.description: This course surveys and analyzes compositions from the Romantic Era through the 21st Century in European classical music history.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: The Beatles
courses.description: This course will examine the cultural phenomena of The Beatles from their early history as a band through the end of their regular collaboration in 1970. While The Beatles have been examined in many different ways, this course will concentrate on their productivity as a rock band through the single pop song, the pop album, and film. It will also serve to provide a more in depth study of the group and their influence on other popular culture.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: History of Film Music
courses.description: This course surveys film music from the silent film era to the present. Topics will include the composers of the genre, the changing musical styles through the decades, and the techniques used by film composers.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Rock Music Through the Mid-60s
courses.description: Surveys rock music from its roots through the mid-60s.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Rock Music Since the Mid-60s
courses.description: Surveys rock music from the mid-60s through the mid-90s.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Private Lesson
courses.description: Weekly private music lessons on an instrument or voice as indicated by the section number. Lessons are fifty minutes per week. The specific day and time is mutually agreed upon by the instructor and the student. Musical style, level of ability, and learning objectives are individually based. Students are encouraged to contact the instructor if they have questions. Students are charged a lab fee every term they register.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Digital Music Composition
courses.description: Digital Music Composition teaches students how to compose music intended to be produced by a computer and related to software, opposed to composing for acoustic instruments. Students will learn how to use specific music software and explore contemporary compositional techniques.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MUSC 121 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Music Composition
courses.description: Music Composition engages students in writing music for ensembles ranging from solo performer to large ensemble. Techniques of the common practice period as well as modernist harmonic techniques will be introduced and applied. Live performance of student projects will be provided and is an important feature of the course.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MUSC 229 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Class Piano II
courses.description: Class Piano II is a continuation of Class Piano I. By the end of the term students will be able to perform a number of simple songs, play several scales and chord progressions, and have basic note reading skills.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MUSC 190 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Class Guitar II
courses.description: Class Guitar II is a continuation of Class Guitar I. In this course students continue to work on note reading in first position, develop rhythmic skills and reading ability in different keys, learn movable barred chords and power chords, and learn basic finger picking technique.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MUSC 191 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Improvisation
courses.description: Provides study and practice of various improvisatory styles in music. Includes classroom lectures, listening, and solo and ensemble performance.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Songwriting
courses.description: Addresses basic songwriting techniques including form, melody, rhythm, lyrics, and production. Projects are required.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MUSC 121 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: World Musics
courses.description: Surveys various musical traditions from around the world in their cultural contexts. Includes selected music from Africa, the Americas, Europe, South Asia, Southeast Asia, Northeast Asia, West Asia, and Oceania.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Afro-American Music USA
courses.description: Examines the African heritage and related New World forms outside the United States. Covers work songs, spirituals, blues, folk music, ragtime, gospel, rhythm and blues, jazz, etc.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: The Power of Black American Music
courses.description: Provides an overview of American Folk music established by Black Americans in the early 1600s. Attention will be given to the African and Caribbean heritage exploring the religious, economic, cultural, and social environment that gave birth to work songs, spirituals, ragtime, blues, jazz, country, gospel, rock ‘n’ roll, rhythm & blues, soul, and hip hop. The course provides the opportunity to listen to music and highlight the musical inventions Black Americans brought to the new world.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: History of Jazz
courses.description: Surveys the music popularly known as jazz from before 1900 through the stylistic changes and trends of the 20th century. Covers precursors, early jazz, big bands, bebop, the new music, etc.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Hip-Hop Music History
courses.description: Hip-Hop Music History is a comprehensive exploration of the origins of hip-hop music, and its meteoric rise to a preeminent genre of popular American music today. Instruction for this course comprises of the examination of hip-hop's noteworthy practitioners, the corroborative technology and propitious media which support it, and the often innovative practice of musical and lyrical creativity that defines the genre.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: American Popular Music
courses.description: Examines popular music (dances, marches, ragtime, jazz, musical comedy, movie music, swing, rock, etc.) from Colonial times to the present, with cultural-historical contexts.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Applied Music-Recital
courses.description: Students will present a public recital featuring significant solo repertoire. Repertoire choices for recital must be made through the Applied Music instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MUSC 241 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Independent Study in Music
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Independent Study in Music
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

courses.subject: MUSC

courses.description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Special Topics in Music
courses.description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

courses.subject: MUSC
courses.title: Special Topics in Music
courses.description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MIP.name: Music Industry Program
MIP.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Survey of the Music Industry
courses.description: This course provides students with an overview of the music industry. The following topics will be addressed: major music industry players (e.g. managers, agents, business managers, promoters), record label operations & functions (e.g. recording deals, royalties, the album cycle), Songwriting/Publishing, Live Music/Touring, & Merchandising.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Audio Production I
courses.description: The objective of this course is to develop an understanding of the best practices of using a Digital Audio Workstation to create a music project. The class will be a combination of lecture modules and in-class hands-on practice.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Copyrights in the Music Industry
courses.description: This course is an in-depth exploration of what, how, when and where intellectual property exists in the music industry, with a particular emphasis on the role that copyrights play.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Introduction to Sound Recording
courses.description: This course introduces the art of sound recording, including the fundamentals of sound, sound capture, acoustic environments, and recording technology.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Audio Systems
courses.description: This course explores the fundamentals of sound capture, audio signals, audio devices, sound systems, and signal interconnections.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Listening Techniques
courses.description: Students will develop critical listening skills needed for all aspects of music production including commercial arranging, tracking, and mixing.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Audio Production II
courses.description: This course will help students develop proficiency in using Pro Tools for advanced music production and sound editing tasks. By engaging in hands-on exercises, lectures, and collaborative projects, students will acquire a comprehensive understanding of advanced recording, editing, and mixing techniques within the Pro Tools environment.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 133 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Live Music I
courses.description: This course will cover the various business aspects of producing and promoting successful tours and concerts. The class will place emphases and cover in great detail: (1) the promoter’s ability to purchase talent and produce shows, taking into consideration such matters as competition, population, guarantees and percentage splits, ticket pricing and distribution, advertising budgets, production costs, sponsorships, rental agreements, labor, security, concessions, tour packages, and promoter-owned venues; and (2) managing and producing a tour, focusing on a tour theme and marketing plan, routing, itineraries, riders, offers, contracts, sub-contractors, show and tour personnel, merchandising, sponsorships, day-of-show and show settlements.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Marketing in the Music Industry I
courses.description: This course aims to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the foundations of marketing and promotion in the music industry, including the essential concepts, strategies, and tactics used by artists and music professionals to create impactful campaigns.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Sound Recording for Business Concentration
courses.description: Sound recording techniques are presented to provide Music Industry Business Concentration students with basic recording competency through practical application. Students are required to create several recordings through projects that require teamwork and self-analysis.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Sound Recording I
courses.description: Basic sound recording procedures are presented with an emphasis on microphone techniques, signal-flow, and session workflow. Requires students to create several multitrack recordings, including editing and mixing.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 233 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI. Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Record Label Operations
courses.description: This course is a general overview of record label operations including the different roles at labels, different types of labels, and how the role of labels have changed over time.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Streaming and Radio Promotion
courses.description: This course provides an overview of how radio and music streaming is used in record promotion and artist development and includes both theory and practical applications.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Community Recording
courses.description: Community Recording is an enterprise designed to foster empowerment and self-expression through music. It brings members of the Mantua, Powelton, and Drexel communities together to create a sustainable creative collective that produces and releases music and shares knowledge and techniques.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Survey of Music Production
courses.description: This course analyzes various music recordings, including the genres of jazz, pop, R&B, and rock, from the modern recording era (1930’s to the present) and discusses the production techniques used to create them.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Music Merchandising
courses.description: Students work in interdisciplinary groups with Design and Merchandising students to create a comprehensive merchandise extension program including product selection, production, distribution and promotion within the context of the artists' overall brand package.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Live Music II
courses.description: This course will cover the various business aspects of producing and promoting a successful concert. The class will place emphases and cover in great detail: the promoter’s ability to purchase talent and a produce show, taking into consideration such matters as competition, population, guarantees and percentage splits, ticket pricing and distribution, advertising budgets, production costs, sponsorships, rental agreements, labor, security, concessions, tour packages, and promoter-owned venues; routing, itineraries, riders, offers, contracts, sub-contractors, show personnel, merchandising, sponsorships, day-of-show and show settlements.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 270 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Audio Production III
courses.description: This course will develop students' understanding of digital audio and MIDI production techniques using Ableton Live by integrating in-class demonstrations, lectures, and hands-on projects and activities. Through these methods, students will acquire a comprehensive understanding of Ableton Live's capabilities and develop practical skills using this software to create high-quality audio productions.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 233 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Contracts and Legal Issues in the Music Industry
courses.description: This course explores contractual agreements and the legal issues affecting the music industry today, such as free speech in radio and music lyrics, rights of publicity for recording artists, fair use and piracy, as well as the various standard agreements in common use in the music and recording industries.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 161 [Min Grade: D] and BLAW 201 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Audio Seminar
courses.description: Students present Extra Curricular recording projects to the instructor and fellow students for an in-class critique. The in-class critique will give the student direct feedback on their creative work and allow them to compare their work against the work of their peers. The production critiques will be moderated by the instructor and grades will be assessed based on in-class participation and presentations.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 4 credits
courses.prerequisites: MIP 379 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Live Music III
courses.description: This course builds on the fundamental relationships in the concert business, from the technical and artistic aspects of concert promotion learned in Live Music II and introduces music tour planning. Students will examine how to hire employees for tour, create budgets, negotiate contracts, promote a tour and the logistics of tour production, marketing and managing government regulations, that in the end, will maximize revenue over multiple shows. Additionally, students will examine the effects of touring over extended times vs single shows, for artists and their touring parties.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 270 [Min Grade: D] and MIP 331 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Artist Development
courses.description: This course introduces concepts including what an A&R rep does, historically and today; artist development in the major label and independent markets; and A&R methods using industry data.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Music Publishing
courses.description: This course explores the fundamental responsibilities of a music publisher including reviewing, evaluating, marketing, licensing, monetizing, representing and protecting original music, as well as the rights of songwriters and related content creators. Students will discover how music publishing is a crucial element of support in a thriving music industry and will learn how music publishers build value for their creative clients.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 161 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Cities of Music and Culture
courses.description: This course is designed to give students an introductory insight and understanding of the music industry in the chosen location of the class. This class is a Study Tour.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Music Supervision
courses.description: Students will be introduced to the creative and administrative elements of music supervision including sourcing, evaluating, licensing, and placing music into visual productions.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 161 [Min Grade: D] or MIP 361 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Entrepreneurship in the Music Industry
courses.description: Students will learn how to devise, conceive, create and implement a music industry-related business through the drafting of a business plan. This course is team-driven and will involve student discussions and critique.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Marketing in the Music Industry II
courses.description: Building on the foundations of Marketing in the Music Industry I, this course provides students with an advanced and applied understanding of the strategies and tactics used to promote music and music-related content across different channels and through various forms of media. Students will utilize insights-driven reasoning, creative ideation, and critical thinking to solve marketing challenges, meet promotional objectives, and drive engagement with target audiences. This course is team-driven and involves extensive student discussions, critique, and group project work in and outside of the classroom.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 132 [Min Grade: D] and MIP 275 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: MAD Dragon Music Group
courses.description: MAD Dragon Music Group is designed to immerse students in the world of the independent music business and includes all of the professor led, student operated enterprises that create, organize and administer MAD Dragon Music Group projects.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits
courses.prerequisites: MIP 132 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Sound Recording II
courses.description: An advanced examination of current state of the art sound recording techniques. Special attention is paid to concert recording, digital and analog mixing techniques, advanced compression and equalization techniques, and time-based processing. Research methods in sound are introduced.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 279 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI and classification is Junior or Pre-Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Audio for Video
courses.description: This course will introduce the student to the technological and creative aspects of creating post-production audio for visual media.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 233 [Min Grade: D] and MIP 279 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Scoring to Picture
courses.description: This course will expand the students' ability to create and produce an original score for an audio/visual element, drawing upon their creative and technological skills.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI. Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Synthesis and Sampling
courses.description: The primary goal of this course is to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of synthesis and sampling techniques used in contemporary music production. Throughout the course, students will develop practical skills and knowledge related to various synthesis techniques, sound design, and the creative application of sampling, ultimately enabling them to produce innovative and high-quality audio elements for various musical genres and projects.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 133 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Studio Maintenance
courses.description: Introduces the student to basic maintenance and troubleshooting techniques used in the modern recording studio. Basic electronic components, cabling, soldering skills, audio measurements, and equipment calibration are emphasized.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 279 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Production Company Management
courses.description: Students will research the basic financial, business, marketing, and networking practices of successful freelancers in the music industry and explore career development strategies to thrive in the music industry gig economy.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI. Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman or Sophomore

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Live Sound I
courses.description: This course covers all aspects of sound reinforcement for live performances, including system design, equipment usage, and acoustical concerns. The course uses both lecture and hands-on components for greater student understanding.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Analog Recording
courses.description: This class enables students to practice the art of analog recording, editing and mixing. It puts in perspective the concepts, tools, and techniques of studio production that can be taken for granted in the digital domain. The constraints and aesthetic choices that are magnified by the analog format are very important parts of a holistic music production curriculum.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 379 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI and classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Live Sound II
courses.description: This course is an examination of current state-of-the-art sound reinforcement techniques. Special attention is paid to system design and optimization, digital mixing console operation, wireless systems, and concert recording.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 389 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Music Industry Data Analytics
courses.description: Through this course, students will gain a deep understanding of the role of data in the business of music, balancing theoretical concepts, illustrative case studies, and practical application.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 132 [Min Grade: D] and STAT 201 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Innovation in the Modern Music Industry
courses.description: This course studies the profound evolution of the music industry by examining entrepreneurial and technological innovation in the post-Napster era. Through in-depth discussions, critical analysis, and collaborative projects, students will gain insight into the cultural, business, and creative transformations driving today’s music landscape, as well as their own potential to contribute to future industry innovation.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman or Sophomore

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Global Recording Business
courses.description: This course is designed to give students a global perspective of the recording business. Students will research individual markets and compare and contrast them in order to evaluate business conditions and consider future economic prospects.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 132 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Audio for Media II
courses.description: This course will present advanced concepts and techniques utilized for creating post-production audio for video, television, and film. Students will also explore other current and future media, such as gaming and VR/XR/MR (virtual reality, extended reality, and mixed reality).
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: FMTV 321 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Audio Production IV
courses.description: In this course, students will gain in-depth knowledge of advanced vocal and drum production techniques using Pro Tools, Ableton Live and Logic Pro. The course is structured around weekly studio sessions and hands-on learning experiences, covering a wide range of topics from vocal recording, and editing to drum replacement and multi-DAW production. Throughout the course, students will have the opportunity to work on various aspects of audio production, including vocal coaching, comping, tuning, alignment, repair, and mixing. Additionally, students will be introduced to multi-DAW production workflows and the process of creating multitrack and stems for mixing and mastering purposes.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 133 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Artist Management
courses.description: This course examines the components that comprise an artist's professional team. The course will explore and analyze the central role that managers, attorneys, agents, business managers, services firms, record labels and other entities each play in representing, developing, and supervising the artist’s overall business and brand.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI. Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Music Industry Colloquium
courses.description: Students will be exposed to state-of-the-art research and industry experience from practitioners and researchers from the local and national stage. This course requires weekly participation in the department colloquium.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 4 credits

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Music Production
courses.description: The students in this class learn contemporary music production techniques through a combination of lecture, demonstration and independent work.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 379 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Mixing
courses.description: This is an advanced audio engineering course that will focus on the technical and creative processes of mixing. Proper equipment usage, methods, formats, and production goals for various genres of music are covered.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 379 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Mastering
courses.description: This course explores the various technical processes involved in professional audio mastering, including dynamic range control, spectral balancing, distortion, and noise detection.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: MIP 481 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Music Industry Research Methods
courses.description: This course is a general overview of research methods used in the music industry. The course presents a conceptual basis for designing research and assessing research quality and illustrates these concepts through in-depth reviews of research areas, including (1) qualitative studies, (2) surveys and (3) experiments. The course also touches on basic descriptive statistics, inferential statistics and measures of association. This is a writing intensive course.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Senior Project in Music Industry
courses.description: Senior Project is a thesis course in which student groups engage over two quarters of senior year in intensive research on a topic selected by a jury among individual proposals. The thesis will result in some form of publishable material.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI and classification is Senior.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Directed Studies in Music Industry
courses.description: Provides supervised individual study of special topics in the music industry. Departmental permission required.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is MUSI.

courses.subject: MIP
courses.title: Independent Study in Music Industry Program
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

PRFA.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: PRFA
courses.title: Community Arts Performance Practicum
courses.description: Provides practical experience as a participant in a Department of Performing Arts community arts initiative. Includes involvement with off campus activities with community members under faculty supervision and direction.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
