PHTO.name: Photography
PHTO.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Photography
courses.description: Lecture-laboratory course in black and white photography. With a combination of lectures, assignments and group critiques, students learn to see photographically through an exploration of the basic tools, techniques and aesthetics of photography. For PHTO Majors, a manual 35mm film camera is required. For PHTO Minors & non-majors a digital point and shoot camera or DSLR, 16 megapixels or greater is required. Cameras that are capable of shooting in RAW format are strongly recommended.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Film Photography I
courses.description: A lecture-laboratory course in black-and-white photography. This class works to develop visual literacy and a comprehensive understanding of the camera and darkroom.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PHTO.

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Digital Photography I
courses.description: The objective of this course is to give you an introduction to the technical skills necessary to use computers, equipment, and software as a means of visually communicating your photographic ideas.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 110 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Digital Photographic Post Production
courses.description: This course is an introduction to the manipulation and output of files using Photoshop and Lightroom. Skills acquired include working with RAW files, density, contrast and color correction, basic retouching, compositing of image, type and color elements along with special effects and output via inkjet printer. A digital point and shoot camera or DSLR, 16 megapixels or greater is required that is capable of shooting in RAW file format.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Intermediate Photography
courses.description: Continues the aesthetic and technical investigations of black and white photography begun in PHTO 110 through a mix of lectures, slide discussions, analytical and creative projects, and group critiques. For PHTO Majors, a manual 35mm film camera is required. For PHTO Minors & non-majors a digital point and shoot camera or DSLR, 16 megapixels or higher is required. Cameras that are capable of shooting in RAW format are strongly recommended.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 110 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Film Photography II
courses.description: Continues the aesthetic and technical investigations of black and white film photography begun in PHTO 120 through a mix of lectures, slide discussions, analytical and creative projects, and group critiques.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 120 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Studio Lighting Techniques
courses.description: This course introduces studio photography practices with a focus on creating a portfolio. Continues utilization of the digital camera. Examines augmenting available light, and artificial lighting techniques. Provides basic approaches to studio photography and how to apply them outside the studio with available materials.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 110 [Min Grade: D] or PHTO 141 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Looking at Photographs
courses.description: Millions of photographic images are produced every day. How do we sort through all those images and make sense of them? This course investigates the many ways photographs inform culture, as well as the means with which culture influences the images we create and absorb every day. We examine common themes and techniques that are used in all aspects of contemporary photography and investigate their origins. The course challenges and sharpens each student's ability to read photographs, greatly enhancing their visual literacy.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Color Photography I
courses.description: This course will introduce students to the foundations of color photography. It is a lecture-laboratory course that combines the visual, technical, and communicative properties of color photography with comprehensive color digital workflow experience. Students will begin to master the techniques of properly color balancing their prints and develop a sense of how to use color. It is important to grasp the foundations of color photography, but it is equally important to understand the aesthetic implications that using color entails.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 210 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Large Format Photography
courses.description: Provides a thorough exploration of large-format camera techniques and large-format film exposure/development techniques including the zone system. Introduces the aesthetic of the large-format black-and-white photograph and expands the student's vision of the potential of the photographic image.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 220 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Studio Photography
courses.description: Introduces professional studio photography practices. Continues utilization of the digital camera. Examines artifical lighting techniques and provides context for exploration of the studio as a creative photographic environment.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 110 [Min Grade: D] and PHTO 210 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Photojournalism
courses.description: Approaches the subject of photojournalism through lectures on its history and current practices and through application. Considers the documentary genre of photography in general.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 210 [Min Grade: D] or PHTO 240 [Min Grade: D] or PHTO 140 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Digital Photography II
courses.description: Explores the digital image within the context of photographic practice. Examines current capabilities and future potentials in image capture, manipulation, output, and dissemination. Projects include utilization of image-manipulation programs, direct digital cameras, and hybrid film/digital approaches. Addresses aesthetic, conceptual, and professional issues.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 210 [Min Grade: D] and PHTO 141 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Fine Black & White Printing
courses.description: Explores the aesthetic of the fine black-and-white print, including issues of print scale, tonality, surface quality, toning, and archival techniques. Uses zone-system analysis to optimize the relationship of the negative and the print.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 220 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: History of Photography I
courses.description: Provides an overview of the history of photography from 1839 to approximately 1930, including technological developments, aesthetic trends, theoretical and philosophical understandings, and effects on society and culture at large.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: History of Photography II
courses.description: Provides an overview of the history of photography from approximately 1930 to the present, including technological developments, aesthetic trends, theoretical and philosophical understandings, and effects on society and culture at large.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 275 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Internship
courses.description: Incorporates a nonpaying internship in the field of photography for academic credit. An initial informational sheet on the internship and a final paper on the experience are required. May be repeated for credit. Department permission required.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PHTO.

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Advanced Studio Photography
courses.description: An advanced studio photography class that will teach the student the workflow associated with high-end digital studio capture. The class will also cover various advanced studio lighting techniques. The development of a personal portfolio of work produced in the studio will be required by all students.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 234 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PHTO.

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Portraiture
courses.description: This course is devoted to the development of a single project. The course will deal in depth with issues of format, lighting and composition. The course will address ethical and legal matters in photographic portraiture. An overview of the history of photographic portrait will be covered.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 230 [Min Grade: D] and PHTO 233 [Min Grade: D] and PHTO 236 [Min Grade: D] and PHTO 253 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Digital Photography III
courses.description: This class will build on intermediate Photoshop skills while exploring the new field of building a photographic image by using more than one frame or multiple elements. Students will be expected to produce a body of work using the skills learned. Large format printing will be stressed.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 141 [Min Grade: D] and PHTO 240 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PHTO and classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Advanced Photography
courses.description: Extends study and experimentation in studio, color, and historical photography. Examines non-silver and non-traditional photographic technologies.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 233 [Min Grade: D] and PHTO 253 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PHTO.

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Junior Project in Photography
courses.description: Integrates the technical and conceptual understandings that the student has acquired in photography through development of a personally defined photographic project. Students will meet in weekly seminars to plan, discuss, and critique in-progress work.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 234 [Min Grade: D] and PHTO 233 [Min Grade: D] and PHTO 236 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PHTO and classification is Junior.

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Photography and Business
courses.description: Seminar course with invited professionals from the photographic and business fields. Helps prospective photographers understand legal aspects of photography, freelance business practices, and potential employment possibilities and expectations.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 233 [Min Grade: D] and PHTO 234 [Min Grade: D] and PHTO 240 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: History of Contemporary Photography
courses.description: The course will focus on aesthetic and conceptual development in contemporary photographic practice. Through lectures, field trips and in-class discussions, students will learn concepts and visual trends employed in photography since 1970. Topics covered include 19th and 20th century influences, multi-cultural interpretation of genres, new approaches to representation of self.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 275 [Min Grade: D] and PHTO 276 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Photography Production
courses.description: The objective of this course is to introduce prospective photographers to production practices. Topics covered will include the varied roles of a photographer/director, production elements, treatment writing, roles of production crews, interpreting layouts and concepts, and approaches to production in contemporary times.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 451 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PHTO and classification is Senior.

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Landscape Photography
courses.description: This class is designed to explore the rich tradition and history of the landscape photograph and how to visually translate the contemporary landscape.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 233 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PHTO and classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Fashion Photography
courses.description: The objective of this course is for students to become familiar with both the aesthetics and techniques involved in the production of fashion photographs. In addition, the history of fashion photography will be covered.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 234 [Min Grade: D] and PHTO 334 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PHTO and classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Palladium Printing
courses.description: This class explores the technical and aesthetic aspects of the 19th century, hand-coated palladium and platinum printing processes. Students will use large format negatives to produce a body of work. This course will include hand-coating techniques, paper and chemistry options.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 233 [Min Grade: D] and PHTO 361 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PHTO and classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Print and Web Portfolio Development
courses.description: This course is designed to prepare students to enter the commercial market. Topics covered will include the definition and marketing of personal visual style, identity and cohesion, and contemporary self-promotion practices.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 451 [Min Grade: D] and PHTO 453 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PHTO and classification is Senior.

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Marketing for Photographers
courses.description: The objective of this course is to give students practical skills about marketing, design, and production of materials you will need as a photographer. Discussions and demonstrations will show you how to use print, web, and other technologies to promote your photography.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 451 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PHTO and classification is Junior or Senior.

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Senior Thesis in Photography I
courses.description: Integrates the technical and conceptual understandings that the student has acquired in photography through development of a personally defined photographic project. Students will meet in weekly seminars to plan, discuss, and critique in-progress work.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 392 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Senior Thesis in Photography II
courses.description: Integrates the technical and conceptual understandings that the student has acquired in photography through development of a personally defined photographic project. Students will meet in weekly seminars to plan, discuss, and critique in-progress work.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 492 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Senior Thesis in Photography III
courses.description: Integrates the technical and conceptual understandings that the student has acquired in photography through development of a personally defined photographic project. Students will meet in weekly seminars to plan, discuss, and critique in-progress work.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 492 [Min Grade: D] and PHTO 493 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PHTO and classification is Senior.

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Exhibition
courses.description: This course is devoted to the final development of your senior thesis project. We will be preparing your work for the final senior thesis exhibition. This will include the final selection of work, sequencing, printing and framing of the work.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PHTO 493 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PHTO
courses.title: Independent Study in Photography
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.

PROD.name: Product Design
PROD.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: History and Analysis of Product Design
courses.description: This class studies the chronological context of the development of the product design profession, relating it to the social, cultural and economic events that helped shape our modern day society. Studies are focuses on major industrial designers and innovations. This course has both a project and written analysis paper component.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Applied Making I
courses.description: This course introduces the development of rapid study models and mid-fidelity prototypes related to product design. Students, through a series of exercises, build study models of products to professional standards of accuracy and finish, with an emphasis on rapid development. Aspects of workshop practice and safety are emphasized.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: WEST 107 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Form Studio
courses.description: This course is the basic introduction to the study of form and abstract visual relationships. It explores the issues concerning the organization of multiple elements of a 3-dimensional composition and form as it relates to the natural world. Its emphasis is on the abstract, rather than the literal, to remove stereotypical object identification.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: WEST 107 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Intro to Product Design
courses.description: This course introduces students to basic product design techniques. It combines lectures, demonstrations, discussions, and problem-solving exercises exploring product design as a creative process in the production of simple objects. Students develop a command of product development, skills in modeling and communication of their novel solutions.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PROD 101 [Min Grade: C] and (PROD 211 [Min Grade: C] or PROD 220 [Min Grade: C])

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Design Thinking in Product Design
courses.description: This course is an integrated lecture/lab introducing principles and theories of product design, systematic design process, problem-solving, decision making and design as authorship. The course uses design research methods, and topical design issues to explore and experience design thinking.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Product Design Form Studio
courses.description: This course uses principles of visual design in the organization of physical elements and analysis of form. Building on abstract relationships, natural inspiration, and the study of visual reference, students develop a sensitivity to form language, semantics, materials, and aesthetics of 3D objects of design. They learn to synthesize this abstract language into functional objects.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: WEST 107 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Computer Aided Imagining in Product Design
courses.description: This is an applied computer class in which students pursue the development of design projects using current product design photo-realistic rendering softward for object design and three-dimensional modeling of products applicable to rapid prototyping.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PROD 265 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PROD.

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Product Design Process Studio
courses.description: In this course students are presented complex design issues in mass-produced objects. Students develop an understanding of the product development process focusing on the designers skills and technical knowledge to formulate appropriate design solutions. Students practice collaboration of ideas with engineers, marketing, users and shareholders.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: (PROD 210 [Min Grade: C] or PROD 212 [Min Grade: C]) and (PROD 220 [Min Grade: C] or PROD 211 [Min Grade: C])

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Applied Design Visualization
courses.description: This course will provide students with schemas and strategies for using visualization as a thinking tool, as well as persuasive techniques for communicating design intent. It will put into practice the essential techniques that product designers use to think and communicate visually.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Smart Product Design
courses.description: To explore ideas around tangible interaction, this course will introduce the smart product development process and combine basic microcontroller programming with digital application development to conceptualize responsive products, environments, and/or materials. Students will design and prototype functional devices that operate using embedded technologies that enhance user experience.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: WEST 107 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Seminar Professional Landscape
courses.description: In this course students explore current trends in the product design profession today. Students will research and present insights into important design issues, trends, and criticism in contemporary product design. Through extensive readings and discussions, students develop an understanding of the relationship of product design to society and culture.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PROD 230 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PROD.

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Applied Materials in Product Design
courses.description: The course emphasizes the practical relationship between product design and the manufacturing industry and the technical considerations that influence the choice of material and process for small batch and mass production.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PROD 235 [Min Grade: C] and MATE 120 [Min Grade: D] and MATE 121 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PROD.

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Introduction to CAD Product Design
courses.description: Introduces the creation and manipulation of three-dimensional digital models and the resultant two-dimensional drawings using computer techniques.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: WEST 107 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Visual Communication for Product Design
courses.description: This course explores the various types of visual communication and presentation fundamentals applying the layout and composition type, color, images, and graphic assets used in product and visual presentation applications.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Soft Goods for Product Design
courses.description: This course combines studio and lecture to introduce students to a variety of soft material structures and soft fabrication methods, and guides them towards purposeful use and innovative applications. Through hands-on prompted experimentation, materials research, materials presentations, instructive editing, and group critique, students will explore the unique role of soft goods in contemporary design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Speaker Making
courses.description: This course will focus on the art and design of building quality speakers. Students will be expected to design and build either a bluetooth speaker or a set of bookshelf speakers. Students will learn how to select drivers, crossovers as well as learn how to calculate the right size enclosure to get the optimum sound out of your speakers. Students will be expected to make a well-crafted and good sounding set of speakers as a final assignment.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Interdisciplinary Product Design Studio
courses.description: Through a focused design project, students of various backgrounds and departments collaborate on complex design issues as they seek to create an appropriate and novel solution to the assigned design problem. Bringing both the PROD majors and PROD minors together, students work as teams through the product development cycle.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PROD 230 [Min Grade: C] and PROD 235 [Min Grade: C] and PROD 255 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Applied Human Centered Design
courses.description: This course explores the physical, psychological, perceptual, and behavioral characteristics of humans. Through a series of lectures and projects, this information is applied to the field of product design to develop safe and effective products.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PSY 101 [Min Grade: D] and PROD 340 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Experimental Design
courses.description: This course is a study into the experimentation and rapid three-dimensional visualization and manipulation of material, form, and function of designed objects no larger than the human body. Students will apply iterative hands-on design process to work through guided assignments to create self-directed project ideas for a variety of contexts. Students will deconstruct preconceived notions of everyday materials, objects, and functions—resolving ideas through technical problem-solving, analog and digital manufacturing, and various CAD software and digital tools.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VSST 102 [Min Grade: D] and (DSMR 100 [Min Grade: D] or WEST 100 [Min Grade: D])

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Applied Design Research
courses.description: This course covers diverse theories and methods for conducting product design research. Emphasis is given to understanding quantitative and qualitative research methods and the role the designer in synthesizing and applying research as a critical part of the design process. This course combines writing and short projects.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: COM 220 [Min Grade: D] and PROD 345 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PROD.

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Design for Manufacturing
courses.description: In Design for Manufacturing, students will have the opportunity to translate a conceptualized idea and design into a portfolio ready, high fidelity prototype. Using methods of contemporary production, each student will undergo the process of designing a product and developing presentable drawings that will be used to fabricate their parts for final assembly. Within this course, there will be an emphasis on computer aided systems that augment conceptual exploration and rapid manufacturing techniques. Vocabulary will be developed via an understanding of and engagement with tooling capabilities, CAD modeling, critical dialogue and investigating the relationship between design and fabrication.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Research Synthesis Studio
courses.description: In this first of two senior studios, students apply their skills to initiate research on an opportunity of their selection. Under supervision, students demonstrate control of applied design research and synthesis. This course focuses on the information gathering, study, and analysis that product designers do to inspire and inform themselves.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PROD 340 [Min Grade: C] and PROD 345 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PROD.

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Create Build Studio
courses.description: In this second of two studios, students apply their skills to develop a solution based on the research conducted in the previous studio. Under supervision, students will demonstrate control of the product design process in the producation of a novel and appropriate user-focused solution.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PROD 460 [Min Grade: C] and PROD 425 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PROD.

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Professional Practice in Product Design
courses.description: This course provides information about career planning and job seeking, including the development of cover letters, resumes, online and physical portfolios and the interview process. Practicing design professionals serve as guest speakers and conduct mock interviews to address topics relevant to the practice of product design.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PROD 460 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PROD.

courses.subject: PROD
courses.title: Exhibition Studio
courses.description: This final studio is a culmination of the educational experience in the production of a senior exhibition highlighting the students' accomplishments. Under supervision, students work together to demonstrate control of all aspects of the design process and visual communication in the production of a graduation exhibition.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: PROD 470 [Min Grade: C]
courses.restrictions: Can enroll if major is PROD.

courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.

courses.subject: RETL
courses.title: Special Topics in Retail Leadership
courses.description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

SCRP.name: Screenwriting & Playwriting
SCRP.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Entertainment Storytelling Fundamentals
courses.description: This course introduces students to the core building blocks of “story” from the perspective of the entertainment industry, where stories are produced for mediums other than literary: film, television, the stage, graphic novels, or video games. Through readings, lectures, discussions and screenings, the class delves into the unique considerations of stories created or adapted for production as visual entertainment artifacts. Analytic examinations of core story-telling differences between various mediums will also be highlighted, to give students insight in later production and studies courses in their chosen medium of expression.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Playwriting I
courses.description: Introduces the basic tenets of playwriting and applies their use towards the writing of a 10-minute play.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Playwriting II
courses.description: Builds on the writing tenets learned in Playwriting I. Requires students to write a one-act play.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 220 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Page to Stage
courses.description: Students will write a short play and then go through the rewrite process while working with a director and student actors. The final scenes will be performed in front of an audience.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 225 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Writing TV Comedy
courses.description: Teaches the essentials of situation comedy writing for TV. Students will be expected to conceive and write their own thirty-minute pilot script plus a ‘bible’ for their show.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 270 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Writing TV Drama
courses.description: Teaches the essentials of writing the one-hour television drama. Students will be expected to conceive and write their own thirty-minute pilot script plus a ‘bible’ for their show.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 270 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Creating Stand-up Comedy
courses.description: Deals with the conception, writing and performance of a stand-up comedy routine. Includes exploration of creating a comic persona, structuring an act, construction of jokes, and aspects relating to perfromance. "Final exam" will be given before a live audience at a public venue.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Masterworks
courses.description: This one-credit course will explore a single film -- of the professor’s choosing -- in depth. Our approach is to watch the film intensely in order to understand its status as a critically lauded signature film, appreciate its aesthetic accomplishment, gain insight into the director’s cinematic style and preoccupations, and, by extension, deepen our understanding of how classic cinema works.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 3 credits
courses.prerequisites: FMST 101 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Writing Comics
courses.description: This course will introduce the student to the history, theory, language and disciplines of writing the American comic book and graphic novel. Students will learn about comic script-writing formats, the collaborative relationship between writer and artist, and techniques to strengthen both their writing and critiquing abilities.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 270 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Screenwriting I
courses.description: Workshop course that covers the fundamentals of writing scripts for film and television.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ENGL 101 [Min Grade: D] or ENGL 105 [Min Grade: D] or ENGL 111 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Screenwriting II
courses.description: Workshop course that builds on the fundamentals of screenwriting learned in Screenwriting I. Each student develops and completes a short dramatic screenplay.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 270 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Writing the Short Film
courses.description: This course will focus on creating scripts for films under thirty minutes in length.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 270 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Writing Episodic Shorts
courses.description: Writing Episodic Shorts is a course targeted primarily at Film & Television Majors with sophomore standing and above. This course will focus on creating scripts for web series under thirty minutes in length. The goal for the ten weeks is to have students develop short scripts that serve as first-draft scripts for production classes within the FMTV curriculum.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 270 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Game: Universe & Story
courses.description: A non-technical course which examines the differences between film & TV works vs. games and interactive fiction forms, and the creative changes inherent in translating one to the other. Emphasis given to the creation of a vibrant, seductive, logically consistent game world. Course culminates in the design of a game based on an existing work of fiction.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 270 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Future of Narrative Games
courses.description: Encourages students to use their knowledge of the current state of the art in gaming, and their technical and writing interests and expertise, to imagine games that go beyond those currently available. Of particular interest are ways to create branching narratives that deliver the story satisfaction and character development expected from traditional media.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 270 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Literature for Screenwriters
courses.description: This course provides exposure to literary traditions from the classics to pop culture, analyzing how the selected books have affected the film industry, both in terms of direct adaptations and by influencing generations of filmmakers and screenwriters.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 270 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Game Development Study
courses.description: This course is a close examination of a single video game studio each term. The course will look at all their current products as well as their company history to reach an understanding of their success story. Special attention will be given to the ways the company frequently differs from other video game companies and companies of similar size. Students will experience these concepts in a hands-on approach by playing through a variety of games, supported with critical classroom discussions.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 270 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: TV Writers' Room
courses.description: Students will write episodes of an ongoing TV comedy series produced at Drexel. Following the network primetime model and working in collaboration, students will work under budget, production and deadline constraints similar to those in the real world.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 270 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: TV Drama Practicum
courses.description: Students will write episodes of an ongoing TV drama series to be produced at Drexel. Following the network primetime model and working in collaboration, students will work under budget, production and deadline constraints similar to those in the real world.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 270 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: An Evening With...
courses.description: Students are given the opportunity to interact with show business creative professionals, including writers, actors, directors, animators, editors and others. Guests will present their work and then discuss it in a free-form Q&A session.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Screenplay Story Development
courses.description: This course provides a thorough understanding of methods used to develop story ideas from initial concept to complete screen story, including pitching, structuring, and creating treatments. Students pitch and develop several stories which can then be used to create full-length scripts in advanced workshops.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 270 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Game Writing Workshop I
courses.description: This course embeds Screenwriting students on a team developing a computer game from concept to design document and through production. Screenwriting majors will be expected to contribute heavily to the narrative, character and other non-technical aspects of game creation.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 290 [Min Grade: C] and SCRP 295 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Game Writing Workshop II
courses.description: This course embeds Screenwriting students on a team developing a computer game from concept to design document and through production. Screenwriting majors will be expected to contribute heavily to the narrative, character and other non-technical aspects of game creation.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 377 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Screenwriting Workshop I
courses.description: The first of a two-course sequence in which students write a feature film script, telefilm, or television pilot.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 275 [Min Grade: D] or SCRP 370 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Screenwriting Workshop II
courses.description: The second of a two-course sequence in which students write a feature film script, telefilm, or television pilot.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 380 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Playwriting Workshop I
courses.description: The first of a two-course sequence in which students write a 90-minute, two-act play.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 225 [Min Grade: D]
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Playwriting Workshop II
courses.description: The second of a two-course sequence in which students write a 90-minute, two-act play.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 382 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Comic/Graphic Novel Writing Workshop I
courses.description: This two-term workshop will lead you through the process of developing and writing at least one draft of the script for either several issues of an original comic or a complete graphic novel. The finished script will be expected to conform to professional standards in everything from length to plot structure to formatting. You will be expected to utilize skills taught in the prerequisite course, SCRP 260 (Comic Book Writing), as well as narrative skills learned in SCRP 270 (Screenwriting I), including, but not limited to, thinking visually, establishing characters through behavior, writing effective dialogue, the basics of story structure, and related topics.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 260 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Comic/Graphic Novel Writing Workshop II
courses.description: This two-term workshop will lead you through the process of developing and writing at least one draft of the script for either several issues of an original comic or a complete graphic novel. The finished script will be expected to conform to professional standards in everything from length to plot structure to formatting. You will be expected to utilize skills taught in the prerequisite course, SCRP 260 (Comic Book Writing), as well as narrative skills learned in SCRP 270 (Screenwriting I), including, but not limited to, thinking visually, establishing characters through behavior, writing effective dialogue, the basics of story structure, and related topics.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 384 [Min Grade: C]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Senior Project in Dramatic Writing I
courses.description: The first of a three-course sequence in which students write a feature film script, telefilm, full-length stage play, television pilot, at least two spec episodes of an existing one-hour TV drama or four of an existing TV comedy.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 381 [Min Grade: D] or SCRP 383 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Senior Project in Dramatic Writing II
courses.description: The second of a three-course sequence in which students write a feature film script, telefilm, television pilot, at least two spec episodes of an existing one-hour TV drama or four of an existing TV comedy.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 495 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: SCRP
courses.title: Senior Project in Dramatic Writing III
courses.description: The third of a three-course sequence in which students write a feature film script, telelfilm, full-length stage play, television pilot, at least two spec episodes of an existing one-hour TV drama or four of an existing TV comedy.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: SCRP 496 [Min Grade: D]

TVPR.name: TV Production
TVPR.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: TVPR
courses.title: TV Studio: Basic Operations
courses.description: This course will focus on developing operational skills for all studio production facilities including camera operations and composition, microphones and audio mixers, basic lighting, teleprompter, video switcher and graphics playback.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: TVPR
courses.title: TV News Writing
courses.description: This is a basic introduction to writing for television news broadcasts. Students will learn to conceptualize, confirm and write stories on deadline, and develop basic interviewing skills. Issue of journalistic ethics will be presented and discussed. Weekly story assignments will be given to augment classroom work.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: TVPR
courses.title: Reality TV Production
courses.description: This course gives students instruction and experience in doing Reality TV shows in the field.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits
courses.prerequisites: (FMVD 110 [Min Grade: D] and FMVD 115 [Min Grade: D] and FMVD 120 [Min Grade: D]) or (FMTV 110 [Min Grade: D] and FMTV 115 [Min Grade: D] and FMTV 120 [Min Grade: D])

courses.subject: TVPR
courses.title: TV On-Camera Performance
courses.description: Students will receive practical experience in all aspects of television performance, including anchoring, reporting, announcing, hosting, and acting. This class is designed specifically for those production students with little or no acting or on-camera experience, but who will benefit from a greater understanding of the performance process.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

TVST.name: TV Studies
TVST.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: TVST
courses.title: Recent TV Trends
courses.description: This course covers recent trends in television, whether on streaming services, premium channels, cable, or on network channels. The focus will be on television shows that have notable narrative and artistic characteristics early on, possibly foretelling their emergence as culturally significant later on.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: TVST
courses.title: TV History
courses.description: This course explores the history of television as art and communication. Topics include: the origins and development of television programming, the regulatory environment and the history of the business of television. Television programs, both fictional and non-fictional, will be viewed from the fifties through the present time.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: TVST
courses.title: History of Television
courses.description: This course explores the history of television as art and communication. Topics include: the origins and development of television programming, the regulartory environment and the history of the business of television. Television programs, both fictional and non-fictional, will be viewed from the fifties through the present time.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: TVST
courses.title: History of TV Journalism
courses.description: This course presents a history of broadcast introduction in the United States. It includes an introduction to the origins, portocals, and principles of journalism on television. It also acquaints students with the prominent trends, programs, and reporting styles throught the decades leading to present-day norms and motivations.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: TVST
courses.title: Art of TV Comedy
courses.description: This course explores the history of television comedy and examines its role as both programming staple and artistic form. By examining how sitcoms reflect our society and its most important social issues, the course seeks to enable students to gauge where both culture and the sitcom are headed.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: TVST
courses.title: Art of TV Drama
courses.description: Students will view and analyze prime-time, hour-long, dramatic TV shows, starting with television's golden age of the fifties and moving to television's "second golden age" starting in the eighties. Students will examine the relationship of the series to other programs, contemporary culture, and television history.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: TVST
courses.title: Science Fiction Television
courses.description: Students will view a progression of science fiction television shows from the fifties to the present time. Students will examine how each show uses an imagined world as a vehicle for exploring facets of our own world. The concepts and the production values will be discussed for each show.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: TVST
courses.title: Teen Television
courses.description: This course looks at acclaimed television programs from the fifties to the present, which present the experience of teenagers as central to the overall show. Students will discuss the content and form of each show, in terms of the directing, the cinematography, the editing, the production design, the sound track, as well as the acting.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: TVST
courses.title: Supernatural Fantasy TV Shows
courses.description: We will examine television shows from the 1950's to the present that include vampires, werewolves, witches, ghosts, demons, monsters, and other beings with unusual abilities that arise from myths, legends, fairytales, and folktales (and not from scientific fact.) We will explore a variety of supernatural themes in television drama, including those that reflect our fears of the unknown and our desires to be more than we are. We will also discuss what goes into creating a high-caliber supernatural drama television show, looking at both the content and the form. We will discuss the writing, the directing, the production design, the camerawork, the sound, the editing, and the special effects.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: TVST
courses.title: Independent Study in TV Studies
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

THTR.name: Theatre
THTR.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Voice and Articulation
courses.description: A beginning course in speech for the stage. The study of standard American speech, techniques for vocal projection, oral interpretation and the effective use of the voice on stage.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Theatrical Experience
courses.description: This course explores the Theatrical Experience from a non-practitioner's perspective. Through lectures, demonstrations, slides and videos students will examine the roles of theatre artists and how they combine their efforts in creating a unique Theatrical Experience.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Philadelphia Theatre Let's Go!
courses.description: Philadelphia Theatre Let's Go! exposes students to the variety of theatrical opportunities available in the Philadelphia region. Through research, discussion and attendance at theatrical productions, students will enhance their abilities to discuss, evaluate and enjoy theatre.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Dramatic Analysis
courses.description: Through the reading of play-scripts, this course will expose students to a variety of methods of play analysis that can be applied to the various theatre disciplines (production, performance, and design). It will also provide students with the methodology to be used in the Theatre History and upper theatre courses.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Introduction to Theater Production Practicum
courses.description: Provides an introduction to the tools, equipment and basic procedures required to enable students to participate in the technical aspects of a theatrical production.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Theatre Performance Practicum
courses.description: Provides practical experience in acting for the stage. Requires student to play a role in a Department of Performing Arts theatre production. May be repeated for credit.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Theatre Production Practicum
courses.description: Provides practical experience in theatre production. Requires students to participate in planning, preparation, and completion of a realized production as a crew head or crew member. May be repeated for credit.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
courses.prerequisites: THTR 130 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Theatre Management Practicum
courses.description: This class provides practical experience in Theatre Management including Production Management, Stage Management, Box Office Management, and other Administrative Management areas for live theatrical events. Students are required to participate in a production for the Theatre Program.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Open Mic Management Practicum
courses.description: Students will gain hands on experience running a performance venue on campus. Students are responsible for daily operations of Late Night Series Productions including: financial operations, strategic planning, artistic management, volunteer coordination, strategic partnerships, artist recruitment and management, marketing, and internet presence. Also all production elements including: sound design and operation, light design and operation, and stage management and run crew.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Theatre Performance Ensemble
courses.description: The Theater Performance Ensemble focuses on a specific area of performance training, creation, and research to supplement the standard theater curriculum in performance. Each quarter focuses on a specific area with emphasis on learning as an ensemble and a priority on developing new skills.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Director's Lab Practicum
courses.description: This course provides practical experience in acting for the stage through participation in a student directed one-act play in conjunction with the Play Directing Class.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Musical Theatre Cabaret
courses.description: An introductory course for singers and non-singers emphasizing applying acting techniques to the performance of a song. Focus will be placed on lyrics, and advancing dramatic action through the song. The class will conclude with a public performance of the material students have worked on in class.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: NewWorks Festival Performance Practicum
courses.description: This course provides practical experience in acting and dramaturgy for the stage through the participation, development, and performance of student written plays.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Advanced Theatre Improvisation Ensemble
courses.description: This course provides practical experience in various forms of Theater Improvisation. Students will put basic skills into practice including listening, building relationships in a trusting ensemble, risk-taking, letting go of fear, spontaneity, and being present. This course will lead to a public presentation of the skills learned.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
courses.prerequisites: THTR 209 [Min Grade: C] (Can be taken Concurrently)

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Improvisation for the Theatre
courses.description: This course is designed to develop spontaneity and increase listening skills. It will begin with exercises in trust building, listening and ensemble building. It will then progress to scenes to increase skill, and by the end of the quarter students will learn long form work that will lead to performance.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Acting: Fundamentals
courses.description: Introductory acting course. Covers basic exercises, improvisations, fundamentals of voice production, and stage movement.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Acting: Scene Study
courses.description: Continues THTR 210. Intermediate course in acting, focusing on application of the techniques of acting through scene study.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 5 times for 12 credits
courses.prerequisites: THTR 210 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Sketch Comedy
courses.description: This course explores the various techniques employed by sketch comedians to imagine and create scripts which spring from a specific point of view. Through exercises and assignments, sketch comedy will be explored as it relates to collaborates writing, improvisation, character development and the rehearsal process.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Theatre History I
courses.description: This course will expose students to the origins of drams from antiquity through the Jacobean period. Through the reading of plays and text, students will explore the relationship of the drama to the social, political, and trends within a given period and how they influenced one another.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: THTR 121 [Min Grade: D] or HUM 103 [Min Grade: D] or HUM 105 [Min Grade: A] or HUM 108 [Min Grade: D] or ENGL 103 [Min Grade: D] or ENGL 105 [Min Grade: A] or ENGL 103 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Theatre History II
courses.description: This course continues the study of drama beginning with the Restoration and continuing through the modern era. Through the reading of plays and texts, students will explore the relationship of the drama to the social, political, and economic trends within a given period and how the influenced one another.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Introduction to Musical Theatre
courses.description: The Musical is one of America’s greatest contributions to the world of theatre. Through class discussions, viewing live performance, audio/video examples, and readings students will explore the development of the American Musical from the Minstrel show through the Golden Age of the Musical.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Contemporary Musical Theatre
courses.description: The Musical is one of America’s greatest contributions to the world of theatre. Through class discussions, viewing live performance, audio/video examples, and readings students will analyze the changes in the American Musical form beginning in the 1960s to the present and predict its future direction.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Theatre Production I
courses.description: Uses lectures, discussions, and practical experience to introduce the processes and equipment used in the production of plays, including scenery construction, lighting, sound, and costuming.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Production Design
courses.description: This course will allow students to expand on principles learned in Dramatic Writing enabling them to develop and communicate, through a variety of means, a unified production concept for a playscript. Students will present their designs in the areas of scenery, costumes and lighting demonstrating their ability to translate their production concept into theatrical reality.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Play Direction
courses.description: Introduces the art of directing, including play analysis, interpretation, rehearsal procedures, techniques of blocking, composition, picturization, and director-actor communications.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: THTR 211 [Min Grade: D] and THTR 121 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Lighting Design
courses.description: This course provides students with a complete introduction to the Theatrical Lighting Design, including discussions of color, composition, movement and electricity. Students apply the principles discusses in a theatre laboratory setting and are prepared to create innovative and practical designs for the stage.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.restrictions: Cannot enroll if classification is Freshman or Sophomore

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Directed Studies in Theatre
courses.description: Provides supervised individual study of special subjects in theatre. May be repeated for credit.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Independent Study in Theatre
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.subject: THTR
courses.title: Independent Study in Theatre
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.title: Special Topics in Theatre
courses.description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

courses.description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

VRIM.name: VR and Immersive Media Design
VRIM.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: VRIM
courses.title: Digital Tools for Immersive Media
courses.description: Students will learn fundamentals of digital tools used for creating Immersive Media including Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR) content. Tools introduced include pixel based image manipulation tools (such as Photoshop), video and animation compositing tools (such as Nuke), 3D CGI tools (such as Maya) and immersive 3d interactive engines (such as Unreal Engine).
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: VRIM
courses.title: Digital Imaging for Immersive Media
courses.description: Students learn foundational image acquisition, lighting and processing techniques and principles utilized for creating Immersive Media including Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR) content. Topics covered include digital still and video imaging and lighting fundamentals and image processing.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: ANIM 100 [Min Grade: D] or DIGM 100 [Min Grade: D] or VRIM 100 [Min Grade: D] or PHTO 141 [Min Grade: D] or VSCM 200 [Min Grade: D] or FMVD 110 [Min Grade: D] or VSST 104 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VRIM
courses.title: Immersive Production Lab I
courses.description: Students learn to integrate principles of color, design, story telling, three dimensional layout, and a users’ sense of presence within Immersive Media by working in small teams to iterate through a number of design and production projects, producing a variety of prototype immersive experiences using readily available components and assets.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: VRIM
courses.title: History of Immersive Media
courses.description: Students learn the pre-cursors to modern Immersive Media forms and the evolution of the art spanning centuries of aesthetic, social and technological development. Concepts in 2D, 3D, VR, AR, Fulldome and other forms of Immersive Media will be covered.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: VRIM
courses.title: Immersive Production Lab II
courses.description: Students learn to integrate principles of color, design, story telling, three dimensional layout, and a users’ sense of presence within Immersive Media by working in small teams to iterate through a number of design and production projects, producing a variety of prototype immersive experiences by implementing their own custom created assets.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: VRIM
courses.title: Professional Practices for Immersive Media
courses.description: Provides a professional orientation to the Immersive Media industry through an exploration of a variety of projects and studies. In addition to lecture and discussions, students learn to take active part in role plays and presentations to achieve an understanding of the importance of team building, team work, and team management in all phases of animation and visual effects productions from proposals to final delivery, as well as personal development and promotion through personal learning, development of work demonstration materials.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VRIM 120 [Min Grade: D]

courses.subject: VRIM
courses.title: Immersive Media Workshop I
courses.description: This course examines the roles of the executive producer and the development team in taking an Immersive Media project from concept to design document through prototype while maintaining close connection to story and communication. Students will work in small teams to research and plan a production effort that results in a pre-production prototype.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: VRIM
courses.title: Immersive Media Workshop II
courses.description: This course provides an environment in which the pre-production of VRIM 310 Immersive Media Workshop I can be taken through a full production effort. Students work in small teams to bring a selected prototype to completion.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: VRIM
courses.title: Motion Capture I
courses.description: Students learn to use motion capture systems for full-body, human performance capture as well as the processing and use of the resulting data in character animation and real-time/game engine applications.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

courses.subject: VRIM
courses.title: Motion Capture II
courses.description: Students learn to use advanced motion capture systems and the data output from these systems. This course combines the use of full-body capture along with facial performance capture as well as the processing and use of the resulting data in character animation and real-time/game engine applications.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.prerequisites: VRIM 388 [Min Grade: B]

courses.subject: VRIM
courses.title: Independent Study in Immersive Media
courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
courses.college: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
courses.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

courses.description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.

courses.title: Special Topics in Immersive Media
